original: de'i phyir dam bca' bar rang gi brjod par bya ba la nges par bsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' bar rang gi brjod par bya ba la nges par bsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the proposition would be ascertained with respect to its content.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo @147a * //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo @147a * //
translated: That is by way of its own nature

original: nas sam khyad par gyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: nas sam khyad par gyi sgo nas te /
translated: or by way of a distinguishing feature.

original: de la gal te ngag dang bden min nyid dag la rnam pa thams cad du nges par bsal ba yin na zhes pa /
analyzed: de la gal te ngag dang bden min nyid dag la rnam pa thams cad du nges par bsal ba yin na zhes pa /
translated: With respect to that, if speech and falsity are ascertained in every way,

original: 'dis chos can dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nges par bsal ba'i sgo nas dam bca' ba'i don nges par bsal bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dis chos can dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nges par bsal ba'i sgo nas dam bca' ba'i don nges par bsal bar ston to //
translated: this shows that the meaning of the proposition is ascertained by way of ascertaining the nature of the subject and the predicate.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that done?üîΩSpeech and falsity are the reason.

original: ngag dang bden pa min ba nyid dag la zhes pa rgyu mtshan gyi don can gyi bdun pa ste /
analyzed: ngag dang bden pa min ba nyid dag la zhes pa rgyu mtshan gyi don can gyi bdun pa ste /
translated: The seventh case, the dative, has the meaning of reason.

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: gal te ngag chos can gyis dang bden min gyi don can bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan gyis rnam pa thams cad du nges par bsal bar phyogs 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te ngag chos can gyis dang bden min gyi don can bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan gyis rnam pa thams cad du nges par bsal bar phyogs 'gyur na'o //
translated: If speech is the subject and the meaning of falsity is the predicate, then the reason is ascertained in every way.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te chos can gyi ngo bo 'am chos kyi ngo bo la gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos can gyi ngo bo 'am chos kyi ngo bo la gnod pa yin na /
translated: If it is the nature of the subject or the nature of the property that is undermined,

original: de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba tshogs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba tshogs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: then the proof is undermined in terms of the collection of the subject and the reason.

original: de ltar gyur na gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo bsal ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gnyis ka'i rang gi ngo bo bsal ba zhes pa'o //
translated: If that is the case, then it is called ‚Äúthe elimination of the nature of both.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes pa 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad kyis bsgrub par bya ba mtha' dag gal te nye bar 'gog par 'gyur na de lta na dam bca'i skyon du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes pa 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad kyis bsgrub par bya ba mtha' dag gal te nye bar 'gog par 'gyur na de lta na dam bca'i skyon du 'gyur gyi /
translated: This ‚Äúin every way‚Äù indicates that if the entire probandum is refuted in every way, then that is a fault of the thesis.

original: ji ltar kha cig smra ba ltar chos can tsam la gnod pas ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di ston par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig smra ba ltar chos can tsam la gnod pas ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di ston par byed do //
translated: It shows that it is not, as some say, that the subject alone is undermined.

original: don 'di kho na 'grub pa'i ched du rnam pa thams cad du zhes pa 'di dam bca'i skyon thams cad la khyab par byed pa lta'o //
analyzed: don 'di kho na 'grub pa'i ched du rnam pa thams cad du zhes pa 'di dam bca'i skyon thams cad la khyab par byed pa lta'o //
translated: This ‚Äúin every way‚Äù is seen to pervade all the faults of the thesis for the sake of establishing this very point.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la mtha'i dper brjod kho na smos par gyur mod kyang 'di ni dam bca'i skyon thams cad kyi thun mong bar rnam par shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la mtha'i dper brjod kho na smos par gyur mod kyang 'di ni dam bca'i skyon thams cad kyi thun mong bar rnam par shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, although only the final example is mentioned here, it should be understood that this is common to all the faults of a thesis.

original: de ltar re zhig sgra ji lta ba bzhin pa'i ngag gi brdzun pa'i don can nyid du gyur na gnyis ka'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bsal ba'o //üîΩda ni sgras zin pa /üîΩdon ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sgra ji lta ba bzhin pa'i ngag gi brdzun pa'i don can nyid du gyur na gnyis ka'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bsal ba'o // da ni sgras zin pa / don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la /
translated: Thus, first, when the statement is literal, the meaning is false, and it is refuted by way of the nature of both.

original: khyad par gyi sgo nas dam bca'i don gsal ba rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgo nas dam bca'i don gsal ba rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to make understood the meaning of the thesis by way of a distinction, when the statement is not literal,üîΩhe says,

original: ci ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one says, etc.‚Äù

original: ngag bdag nyid kyi zhes pa /
analyzed: ngag bdag nyid kyi zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe statement itself‚Äù

original: ngag gi bdag nyid dam yang ngag gi bdag nyid ngag yin pa de de skad brjod de /
analyzed: ngag gi bdag nyid dam yang ngag gi bdag nyid ngag yin pa de de skad brjod de /
translated: means the statement itself or the statement is the nature of the statement. That is what is said.

original: 'di'ang ci zhe na chos can ngag gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di'ang ci zhe na chos can ngag gi khyad par ro //
translated: What is this? It is the distinction of the subject, the statement.

original: 'di ci las she na gang las de ngag gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ci las she na gang las de ngag gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: What is this from? It is from the statement itself.

original: gzhan yang chos can dang chos kyi khyad par sel ba rtogs par byed pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos can dang chos kyi khyad par sel ba rtogs par byed pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is the context for understanding the elimination of the distinction between the subject and the predicate.

original: gang gi phyir de ma thag pa kho nar bshad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ma thag pa kho nar bshad pa /
translated: Because it was just explained:

original: de ltar gyur na gnyis @147b ka'i khyad par bsal ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gnyis @147b ka'i khyad par bsal ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, the distinction between the two is eliminated.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'di spyi'i sgra yin yang skabs las dang shugs las ngag gi khyad par kho na la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di spyi'i sgra yin yang skabs las dang shugs las ngag gi khyad par kho na la 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, although this is a general term, from the context and the force of the statement, it applies only to the distinction of the words.

original: khyad par gyi sgra nye ba kho na ni ngag rnams kyi khyad par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra nye ba kho na ni ngag rnams kyi khyad par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: The mere proximity of the term distinction is not the cause for positing the distinction of the words.üîΩHowever, the context and so on are also.

original: 'on kyang skabs la sogs pa'ang yin no zhes pa gnas ma yin pa'i log par rtogs pas chog go //üîΩbden pa min pa don can nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: 'on kyang skabs la sogs pa'ang yin no zhes pa gnas ma yin pa'i log par rtogs pas chog go // bden pa min pa don can nyid kyis kyang //
translated: That is enough of this pointless wrong thinking.üîΩAlso, because it has a meaning that is not real.

original: zhes pa / bden pa min pa'i don te brjod bya can no //
analyzed: zhes pa / bden pa min pa'i don te brjod bya can no //
translated: It has a meaning that is not real, that is, it has an expressed meaning.

original: de'i dngos po ni bden pa min pa'i don can nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bden pa min pa'i don can nyid do //
translated: Its thing is the fact that it has a meaning that is not real.

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the distinction of the predicate of the proposition.

original: 'di'ang bar ma chad par brjod pa'i 'thad pa kho nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'ang bar ma chad par brjod pa'i 'thad pa kho nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This also should be understood by the very same reasoning of uninterrupted expression.

original: kyang gi sgra las khyad par gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra las khyad par gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ngo //
translated: By the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù [in the root text], there are some other distinctions.

original: gsum pa 'di ni rgyu la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni rgyu la'o //
translated: The third [distinction] is in regard to the cause.

original: des na ngag gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: des na ngag gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the statement [in the root text]:

original: ci ste chos can gyi khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas dang / chos kyi khyad par bden pa min pa'i tshig gi brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: ci ste chos can gyi khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas dang / chos kyi khyad par bden pa min pa'i tshig gi brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i rgyus /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the distinction of the subject, such as impermanence, and the distinction of the property, such as the fact that it is not the object of expression of true speech,

original: de bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du dam bca' ba'i don bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du dam bca' ba'i don bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are removed, then the meaning of the thesis will be completely removed.‚Äù

original: de ltar gnyis ka dag gi khyad par bsal ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka dag gi khyad par bsal ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the distinction of both [the subject and the property] is removed.

original: de ltar na 'dir dam bca'i ngag gis dang / rjes su bsgrags pa'i ngag gis yang don ji lta ba nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' bas kyang rang gi don kho na bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pas rang gi tshig 'gal ba dam bca'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir dam bca'i ngag gis dang / rjes su bsgrags pa'i ngag gis yang don ji lta ba nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' bas kyang rang gi don kho na bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pas rang gi tshig 'gal ba dam bca'i skyon yin no //
translated: Thus, here, the statement of the thesis and the statement of the conclusion are not in accordance with fact. Therefore, the fault of the thesis is that your own words are contradictory.

original: 'o na ngag rnams kyi ngo bo dang khyad par 'di gnyis ka yang mngon sum la sogs pas rab tu grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ngag rnams kyi ngo bo dang khyad par 'di gnyis ka yang mngon sum la sogs pas rab tu grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: Well, the essence and the distinction of these statements are established by direct perception and so forth.

original: des na de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ci ltar yin zhen /
analyzed: des na de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ci ltar yin zhen /
translated: Therefore, how could they be otherwise?

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: de ltar na ni dam bca' bar bya bzhin par gyur ba na 'di mi 'dod par thal par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni dam bca' bar bya bzhin par gyur ba na 'di mi 'dod par thal par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: If it were so, then it would follow that you do not accept this, which is what you are trying to prove.

original: ngag gi don gyi dbang las 'di 'di ltar smra ba po la nye bar dmigs par 'byung gi / dngos po'i dbang las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi don gyi dbang las 'di 'di ltar smra ba po la nye bar dmigs par 'byung gi / dngos po'i dbang las ni ma yin no //
translated: This is spoken by the speaker in accordance with the power of the meaning of the statement, not in accordance with the power of the thing.

original: tshig gi yon tan dang skyon dag ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par skabs yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig gi yon tan dang skyon dag ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par skabs yin gyi /
translated: The good qualities and faults of words are to be inferred from their meaning.üîΩ

original: don gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The good and bad qualities of words are to be inferred in terms of their meaning, not in terms of their words.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, even if there is contradiction with perception and so on,

original: de la ltos pa med par sgra'i don la ltos par rang gi tshig 'gal ba 'di 'byung ngo zhes pa kha na ma thob med do //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med par sgra'i don la ltos par rang gi tshig 'gal ba 'di 'byung ngo zhes pa kha na ma thob med do //
translated: there is no fault in saying that the contradiction of the words is due to their meaning, not to their words.

original: gal te khyad @148a * //
analyzed: gal te khyad @148a * //
translated: If you say that the reason is not established,

original: par ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub byed mi srid pa'i phyir phyogs ltar snang bar bshad pa de rnams 'dir cis ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: par ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub byed mi srid pa'i phyir phyogs ltar snang bar bshad pa de rnams 'dir cis ma bshad ce na /
translated: why is it not explained here that the reason is not established?

original: gang gi phyir de rnams la dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i skyon las sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams la dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i skyon las sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa yin gyi /
translated: Because in those cases, the proof is impossible due to the fault of the example lacking the property to be proven, and so on.

original: dam bca' ba tsam gyis ma yin pa des na ma brjod do //
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam gyis ma yin pa des na ma brjod do //
translated: Since it is not merely the thesis that is not established, it is not mentioned.

original: ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa skyon thams cad kyis kyang phyogs kho na la nye bar gnod cing /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa skyon thams cad kyis kyang phyogs kho na la nye bar gnod cing /
translated: All faults such as the reason not being established only harm the position,

original: de lta bu de las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu de las kyang /
translated: In that case,

original: de lta na yang phyogs ltar snang ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyogs ltar snang ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: if it is a mere semblance of a thesis,

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa rnams kyang phyogs ltar snang bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la de 'dod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa rnams kyang phyogs ltar snang bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la de 'dod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: then even unestablished reasons and so on would be called mere semblances of theses, but that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir gal te yang sgrub par byed pa'i skyon thams cad kyis phyogs nyid 'gog pa de lta na'ang dam bca' tsam la 'byung ba rnams kho na phyogs kyi skyon nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yang sgrub par byed pa'i skyon thams cad kyis phyogs nyid 'gog pa de lta na'ang dam bca' tsam la 'byung ba rnams kho na phyogs kyi skyon nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even if all the faults of a proof are the refutation of the thesis itself, still, only the faults of the thesis arise in regard to the mere thesis.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don gzhan 'di gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don gzhan 'di gsal bar byed pa /
translated: For that very reason, this other meaning is clarified:

original: dam bca' tsam dang zhes pa'i tshig thams cad du khyab par byed par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam bca' tsam dang zhes pa'i tshig thams cad du khyab par byed par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù should be seen as pervading all the words of the thesis.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yin pa de'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa la sogs pa der gang phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa yan lag phyi ma la ltos nas skyon du 'gyur ba de ni de kho na'i yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yin pa de'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa la sogs pa der gang phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa yan lag phyi ma la ltos nas skyon du 'gyur ba de ni de kho na'i yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no zhes
translated: Because it is so, therefore, the fault that is in the particular that is not established and so on, which is dependent on the subsequent parts such as the property of the subject, is only in that, but not in the position.

original: bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa rnams phyogs kyi skyon ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa rnams phyogs kyi skyon ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the particular that is not established and so on are not faults of the position.

original: rigs pa can rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and so on say:

original: ni'i sgra ni lugs gzhan las khyad par gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni lugs gzhan las khyad par gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word ni makes it clear that there is a difference from another system.

original: bsgrub bya ston pa dam bca'o zhes 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra 'di grub zin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ston pa dam bca'o zhes 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra 'di grub zin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe thesis is the presentation of the probandum‚Äù does not express the word probandum as something already established.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par byar 'os pa'o zhes pa 'di tsam gyi don rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par byar 'os pa'o zhes pa 'di tsam gyi don rjod par byed cing /
translated: Rather, it expresses the mere meaning of ‚Äúthat which is suitable to be proven.‚Äù

original: grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not established.

original: grub pa ma yin pa dgag ba tsam la don spyad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: grub pa ma yin pa dgag ba tsam la don spyad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is not established, the mere negation of something is taken to be the meaning.

original: de kho na la nus pa nye bar zad pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na la nus pa nye bar zad pa'o //
translated: It is exhausted in just that.

original: rtsom pa gzhan med par bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par du gnas te /
analyzed: rtsom pa gzhan med par bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par du gnas te /
translated: Without another undertaking, it abides as a particular object of affirmation.

original: des na skyon ci yod ces zer ro //
analyzed: des na skyon ci yod ces zer ro //
translated: Therefore, what is the fault?‚Äù

original: de lta na ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In response, [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] states, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na sgra mi rtag go zhes bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni dam bca' yin la /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag go zhes bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni dam bca' yin la /
translated: For example, in the case of the desire to affirm that sound is impermanent, the statement of the object of affirmation is the thesis.

original: de ltar yin na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe rjod par byed pa /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe rjod par byed pa /
translated: If that were the case, then the statement of a reason and example that are not established would

original: dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dam bca' bar thal bar 'gyur /
translated: be a thesis.

original: 'o na sgra rtag pa @148b nyid la sogs pa sgrub pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra rtag pa @148b nyid la sogs pa sgrub pa'i dus na /
translated: Well then, when establishing that sound is permanent, etc.,

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: it is not at all asserted that the reason and example that are not established are objects of affirmation.

original: des na thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, why is this consequence the case?

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i rkyen gyi mtha' can yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i rkyen gyi mtha' can yin la /
translated: Because the sound that is the object of affirmation ends with the suffix of the present tense.

original: bya ba'i rkyen rnams kyang dus gsum pa'i yul can yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: bya ba'i rkyen rnams kyang dus gsum pa'i yul can yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su /
translated: The conditions of action are also objects of the three times. Therefore, in the context of proving permanence and so on,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du pha rol po'i ngor ma grub pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du pha rol po'i ngor ma grub pa gang yin pa /
translated: whatever is not established for the opponent as the nature of permanence and so on,

original: de lta'i dngos por nye bar bkod pa bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur pa blo la sogs pa de sgra rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i dus na mi 'dod na'ang bsgrub par 'os pa nyid kyis na bsgrub par bya ba kho na'o zhes pas de
analyzed: de lta'i dngos por nye bar bkod pa bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur pa blo la sogs pa de sgra rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i dus na mi 'dod na'ang bsgrub par 'os pa nyid kyis na bsgrub par bya ba kho na'o zhes pas de
translated: that thing that is to be established, such as cognition, and so on, even if not accepted at the time of proving the permanence of sound and so on, is still the thesis because it is suitable to be established.üîΩTherefore,

original: brjod pa ni dam bca' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod pa ni dam bca' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that it is the thesis itself.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra ni de'i tshe gang cung zad ma grub pa de thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra ni de'i tshe gang cung zad ma grub pa de thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If the word ‚Äúthesis‚Äù does not include all that is not established at that time,

original: rgo la ba'i bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i khyad par de kho na 'dzin pa yin mod /
analyzed: rgo la ba'i bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i khyad par de kho na 'dzin pa yin mod /
translated: but only that particular thing that is asserted as the thesis by the opponent,üîΩthen

original: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa brjod pa kho na dam bca' bar cis 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa brjod pa kho na dam bca' bar cis 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could the mere expression of an unestablished reason, etc. be a thesis?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: ma grub pa brjod pa thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa brjod pa thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: Not all expressions of the unestablished are theses,

original: shes par byed pa'i skabs las gzhan rnams thal bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i skabs las gzhan rnams thal bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other ones are not the consequence of the context of the proof.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma grub pa brjed pa thams cad kyang dam bca' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma grub pa brjed pa thams cad kyang dam bca' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all expressions of the unestablished, such as the horn of a rabbit, would be theses.

original: de'i phyir shes par byed pa'i skabs las mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes par byed pa'i skabs las mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the unestablished is not a thesis in the context of the proof.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That is so, but

original: rang gi ngo bos las la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnams rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos las la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnams rnam par gnas la /
translated: the establishment of action, etc. by its own nature is well established.

original: bya ba'i rkyen 'di ni las la ste /üîΩdes na las brjod pa'i ngang tshul can /
analyzed: bya ba'i rkyen 'di ni las la ste / des na las brjod pa'i ngang tshul can /
translated: This condition of action is the object of the action.üîΩTherefore, the expression of action is not the expression of the probandum.

original: bsgrub bya'i sgras bsgrub bya ma yin pa 'phen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i sgras bsgrub bya ma yin pa 'phen pa ma yin no //
translated: The probandum is not implied by the word probandum.

original: byed pa pos shin tu 'dod par gyur pa ni las yin la /
analyzed: byed pa pos shin tu 'dod par gyur pa ni las yin la /
translated: The object of the action is the action that is very much desired by the agent.

original: de'i tshe ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the unestablished reason, etc. are not accepted as the probandum.

original: grub mtha' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: grub mtha' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The conclusion is also of four kinds:

original: rgyud thams cad kyi grub mtha' dang / so so'i rgyud kyi grub mtha' dang / skabs kyi grub mtha' dang / khas blangs pa'i grub mtha'o //üîΩde la rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni don gang rgyud rnams thams cad du dbang du byas pa rgyud @149a * //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi grub mtha' dang / so so'i rgyud kyi grub mtha' dang / skabs kyi grub mtha' dang / khas blangs pa'i grub mtha'o // de la rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni don gang rgyud rnams thams cad du dbang du byas pa rgyud @149a * //
translated: the conclusion of all the tantras, the conclusion of each tantra, the conclusion of the occasion, and the conclusion of the assertion.

original: thams cad dang mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad dang mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: Among them, the conclusion of all the tantras is the meaning that is controlled by all the tantras, not in conflict with all the tantras.

original: dper na gzhal bya'i don 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams yod do zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhal bya'i don 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams yod do zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThe valid cognitions that apprehend the object of evaluation exist.‚Äù

original: chos gang rang gi ba'i rgyud du grub la gzhan gyi rgyud du ma grub pa de ni so so'i rgyud kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /üîΩdper na thams cad gcig ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang rang gi ba'i rgyud du grub la gzhan gyi rgyud du ma grub pa de ni so so'i rgyud kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste / dper na thams cad gcig ba'am /
translated: The conclusion of each tantra is the dharma that is established in one‚Äôs own tantra but not established in another tantra.

original: tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúEverything is one‚Äù or ‚ÄúEverything is different.‚Äù

original: thams cad mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa'am /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúEverything is impermanent‚Äù or ‚ÄúEverything is permanent.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The permanent and so on are examples.

original: gang 'grub pa na rnam pa gzhan 'grub pa de ni skabs kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: gang 'grub pa na rnam pa gzhan 'grub pa de ni skabs kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The established tenet is that which is established when something is established.

original: dper na lus can ma yin pa'i bdag nyi shi nas 'bras bu rnams longs spyod de /
analyzed: dper na lus can ma yin pa'i bdag nyi shi nas 'bras bu rnams longs spyod de /
translated: For example, when it is said that the nonembodied self enjoys the fruits after death,

original: der lus 'byung ba yod pa ni ma yin zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: der lus 'byung ba yod pa ni ma yin zhes brjod pa na /
translated: and that the body does not exist there,

original: bdag yod bar grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag yod bar grub par 'gyur la /
translated: it is established that the self exists.

original: 'di lus las gong du'ang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //üîΩma brtags par khas blangs pa las de'i khyad par rtogs pa ni khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'di lus las gong du'ang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o // ma brtags par khas blangs pa las de'i khyad par rtogs pa ni khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: And it is said that it is superior to the body.üîΩThe established tenet of acceptance is the understanding of its distinctions from the acceptance of what is not examined.

original: gang ma brtags shing nye bar ma bstan pa khas blangs nas de'i khyad par rnam par dpyod par byed pa de khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: gang ma brtags shing nye bar ma bstan pa khas blangs nas de'i khyad par rnam par dpyod par byed pa de khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The established tenet of acceptance is the analysis of its distinctions from the acceptance of what is not examined or taught.

original: dper na ma brtags par bdag yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: dper na ma brtags par bdag yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: For example, when the existence of the self is accepted without examination,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is analyzed as impermanent and so on.

original: de ltar grub mtha' rnam pa bzhi po skabs su byas nas bsgrub bya ston pa dam bca'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar grub mtha' rnam pa bzhi po skabs su byas nas bsgrub bya ston pa dam bca'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having made the occasion of the four philosophical systems, he says, ‚ÄúThe thesis is the statement of the probandum.‚Äù

original: grub mtha'i mtshan nyid can kho na ston pa dam bca' yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grub mtha'i mtshan nyid can kho na ston pa dam bca' yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only that which has the definition of a philosophical position is a thesis, and nothing else.

original: gzhan yang dam bca' dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam bca' dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the thesis, reason, example, application, and conclusion

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag rnams kyi skabs su grub par byed pa'i yul gang yin pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag rnams kyi skabs su grub par byed pa'i yul gang yin pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
translated: are the branches of proof. The object of proof is the probandum.

original: de ston pa dam bca'o zhes kyang don gyis rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ston pa dam bca'o zhes kyang don gyis rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is understood by implication that the thesis is the statement of that,

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa dam bca' nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa dam bca' nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: an unestablished reason and so on are not theses.

original: de 'dir bsgrub bya gang yin pa de ni las yin te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis thams cad ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dir bsgrub bya gang yin pa de ni las yin te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis thams cad ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the probandum is the object, because it is not established in any way.

original: gang bsgrub par bya bzhin pa dang gang bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba de thams cad ni las yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang bsgrub par bya bzhin pa dang gang bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba de thams cad ni las yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Whatever is being accomplished and whatever will be accomplished are all just actions.

original: de'i phyir re zhig dang po lan ma yin no //üîΩgang yang bsgrub bya'i yan lag yin pa de ston pa dam bca' zhes brjod pa 'di'ang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dang po lan ma yin no // gang yang bsgrub bya'i yan lag yin pa de ston pa dam bca' zhes brjod pa 'di'ang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, first, it is not a response.

original: sngar ma grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ma grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, it is not correct to say that the thesis is the statement of the part to be accomplished, because it is not established previously.

original: gang gis sngar bsgrub bya'am sgrub par byed pa grub pa @149b ma yin pa des /
analyzed: gang gis sngar bsgrub bya'am sgrub par byed pa grub pa @149b ma yin pa des /
translated: By whom, previously, the thesis or the proof is not established,

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig las de dag gi so sor dbye ba rtogs par bya la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig las de dag gi so sor dbye ba rtogs par bya la /
translated: the distinction between them should be understood from the words of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi rnam par dbye ba ma bzung bas ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi rnam par dbye ba ma bzung bas ni /
translated: Since the distinction between the thesis and the proof is not grasped in the context of the definition,

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang dam bca' ba nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes pas /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang dam bca' ba nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes pas /
translated: one would grasp nonestablished reasons and so on as being the thesis.

original: bsgrub par bya pa'i khyad par rtogs pa ga la yin /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya pa'i khyad par rtogs pa ga la yin /
translated: How then could one understand the distinction of the thesis?

original: grub mtha'i skabs kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grub mtha'i skabs kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the context of philosophical tenets, the specific thing to be established is not the means of establishing.

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang grub mtha' nyid du mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang grub mtha' nyid du mtshungs so //
translated: Because the reason, etc. are also the same as the philosophical tenets.

original: de ltar ni thams cad kyi rgyud kyi grub mtha' la sogs pa rnams thams cad khyad par du khas blangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni thams cad kyi rgyud kyi grub mtha' la sogs pa rnams thams cad khyad par du khas blangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kho na'o //
translated: In this way, all the philosophical tenets, etc. of the continuum of all are only characterized by the acceptance of the specific.

original: gang gi phyir dpyod pa'i rten kho nar tshad ma rnams khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpyod pa'i rten kho nar tshad ma rnams khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Because the valid cognitions are accepted only as the basis of analysis.

original: de rnams med na rnam par dpyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med na rnam par dpyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if they did not exist, analysis would be impossible.

original: so so'i rgyud kyi grub mtha' ru yang /
analyzed: so so'i rgyud kyi grub mtha' ru yang /
translated: Even in the philosophical tenets of the individual continuum,

original: des rab tu grub pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa rnams bye brag pa la sogs pas khas blangs ba kho na ste /
analyzed: des rab tu grub pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa rnams bye brag pa la sogs pas khas blangs ba kho na ste /
translated: the meanings of the statements established by them are only accepted by the Vai≈õe·π£ika, etc.

original: gang shi nas bdag 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid du 'dod pa des nges par bdag kyang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang shi nas bdag 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid du 'dod pa des nges par bdag kyang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa kho na'o //
translated: Whoever asserts that after death the self is the enjoyer of the fruits definitely only accepts that the self exists.

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang gal te yang de'i tshe khas ma blangs pa de lta na'ang /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa'ang gal te yang de'i tshe khas ma blangs pa de lta na'ang /
translated: Also, with regard to a reason that is not established, if at that time it is not accepted, then it is not established.

original: khas blang byar 'gyur ba la der bya ba'i rkyen bstan ba kho na las grub mtha' nyid du 'thob bo zhes pas /
analyzed: khas blang byar 'gyur ba la der bya ba'i rkyen bstan ba kho na las grub mtha' nyid du 'thob bo zhes pas /
translated: But if it is to be accepted, then it is established merely by the statement of the condition of the object to be accomplished, and it is obtained as a tenet.

original: ci'i phyir grub mtha'i skabs las bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par 'grub pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir grub mtha'i skabs las bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par 'grub pa yin /
translated: Why is it that the specific object to be established is established from the section on tenets?

original: chos bsgrub bya na chos mthun med //
analyzed: chos bsgrub bya na chos mthun med //
translated: If a property is to be established, there is no similar property.

original: ces pa chos bsgrub par bya ba yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos mthun pa nyid las de'i chos rtags pa'i tshul can dpe yin par dper brjod do zhes pa 'gal te /
analyzed: ces pa chos bsgrub par bya ba yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos mthun pa nyid las de'i chos rtags pa'i tshul can dpe yin par dper brjod do zhes pa 'gal te /
translated: This is contradictory because it is said that if a property is to be established, then the example is the example that has the mode of the property of the subject, which is from the similar property itself.

original: de ltar ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid kyi skye ba can la sogs pa chos su 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid kyi skye ba can la sogs pa chos su 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In that case, arising and so on are not properties of the property of the subject, impermanence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na sgra'i'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na sgra'i'o //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWell then, what is it?‚Äù it is the property of sound.

original: de las kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba dang skye ba can nyid la sogs pa chos mthun pa nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe la med do zhes pas /
analyzed: de las kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba dang skye ba can nyid la sogs pa chos mthun pa nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe la med do zhes pas /
translated: Moreover, impermanence and so on, which are the probandum, and the common property of having arising and so on, do not exist in the example of the pot and so on.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang chos mthun pa nyid las de'i chos rtogs pa'i tshul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang chos mthun pa nyid las de'i chos rtogs pa'i tshul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be the common property of the probandum that is the means of understanding its property.

original: chos can yin na rtags don med //üîΩces pa dper brjod pa dang chos mthun pa nyid las bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa gtan @150a * //
analyzed: chos can yin na rtags don med // ces pa dper brjod pa dang chos mthun pa nyid las bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa gtan @150a * //
translated: If it is the subject, the reason is pointless.

original: tshigs yin no zhes pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: tshigs yin no zhes pa mi rigs te /
translated: The statement that the example is the means of establishing the probandum through its common property with the subject is illogical.

original: gang gis de sgrub par byed pa las bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba sgra'i sgra ma grub pa ma yin no zhes pas gtan tshigs don med do //
analyzed: gang gis de sgrub par byed pa las bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba sgra'i sgra ma grub pa ma yin no zhes pas gtan tshigs don med do //
translated: Since the sound of the word is not established as the means of establishing that, the reason is pointless.

original: ci ste gnyis ka gtsor yin pa de'i tshe gnyis ka bsgrub par bya ba nyid la 'byung ba'i skyon de mi zlogs pa kho na'o zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis ka ltar na'ang skyon zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste gnyis ka gtsor yin pa de'i tshe gnyis ka bsgrub par bya ba nyid la 'byung ba'i skyon de mi zlogs pa kho na'o zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis ka ltar na'ang skyon zhes pa'o //
translated: But if both are primary, then the fault that arises from the fact that both are the probandum cannot be averted.

original: snga mar nges gzung zhes pa kho na'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir nges par gzung ba'i sgras brjod do //üîΩsngon mar nges par gzung ba ni /
analyzed: snga mar nges gzung zhes pa kho na'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir nges par gzung ba'i sgras brjod do // sngon mar nges par gzung ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in ‚Äúonly in the former‚Äù has the meaning of restriction, and therefore it is expressed by the word ‚Äúrestriction.‚Äù

original: snga mar nges gzung ste /
analyzed: snga mar nges gzung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúRestriction in the former‚Äù is ‚Äúrestriction in the former.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du phyi mar nges gzung la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi mar nges gzung la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúrestriction in the latter‚Äù should be applied.

original: snga mar nges gzung don med do //
analyzed: snga mar nges gzung don med do //
translated: ‚ÄúRestriction in the former is meaningless.‚Äù

original: zhes pa 'di la gtan tshigs gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di la gtan tshigs gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the reason is stated.

original: sgrub byed ston pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed ston pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word that indicates the probandum‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di'i don 'di yin te /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba ston pa kho na zhes yongs su pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don 'di yin te / bsgrub par bya ba ston pa kho na zhes yongs su pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of this.üîΩ‚ÄúOnly the indication of the probandum‚Äù is the restriction.

original: sgrub byed kyi tshig dam bca'am yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgrub byed kyi tshig dam bca'am yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe word that proves is the thesis,‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshig dam bca' ba nyid du thal ba yang ma yin no zhes pas sgrub byed kyi tshig dam bca' ba nyid du dogs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshig dam bca' ba nyid du thal ba yang ma yin no zhes pas sgrub byed kyi tshig dam bca' ba nyid du dogs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that the words of proof are suspected to be a thesis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pas de la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pas de la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason, etc. pervade it.

original: 'o na gang bsgrub par bya ba'ang ma yin la sgrub par byed pa'ang ma yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gang bsgrub par bya ba'ang ma yin la sgrub par byed pa'ang ma yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that ‚Äúthen, since that which is neither the probandum nor the proof has the meaning of exclusion, it is not meaningless,‚Äù it is not so.

original: shes byed kyi skabs kyi phyir de ltar gyur pa skabs ma yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba nyid du thal ba ma yin no zhes pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: shes byed kyi skabs kyi phyir de ltar gyur pa skabs ma yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba nyid du thal ba ma yin no zhes pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: Because it is the context of the proof, it is not the context of that, and therefore it is not the case that it follows that it is a thesis. This has already been explained.

original: ci ste zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúBut if the reason, etc. are not the proof, then the thesis is not the proof,‚Äù it is not so.

original: 'dir tshig phrad ni mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin gyi gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcad pa ni ma yin zhes pas ma grub pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa'ang dam bca' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir tshig phrad ni mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin gyi gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcad pa ni ma yin zhes pas ma grub pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa'ang dam bca' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the particle ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the effect of excluding non-possession, but it does not exclude possession of something else. Therefore, the statement of a non-established proof would also entail the consequence of being a thesis.

original: de bzhin bsgrub bya brjod la'ang //
analyzed: de bzhin bsgrub bya brjod la'ang //
translated: Similarly, with regard to the statement of the probandum,

original: zhes ba rtsod pa bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa dam bca'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes ba rtsod pa bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa dam bca'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the definition of a thesis is: a statement of the probandum in a debate.

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba ton pa dam bca'o zhes pa 'di la skyon gang bshad pa de 'dis bsgres te ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba ton pa dam bca'o zhes pa 'di la skyon gang bshad pa de 'dis bsgres te ston par byed do //
translated: Here, the fault that is explained with regard to the statement ‚Äúthe probandum is the thesis‚Äù is shown by this [verse].

original: phyogs lhag phyir na srid ma yin //
analyzed: phyogs lhag phyir na srid ma yin //
translated: It is not possible because of the remainder of the position.

original: zhes pa / ji skad bshad pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: zhes pa / ji skad bshad pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault that was explained.

original: rnam par dpyad pa la 'dod pa'i don phyogs yin zhes pa skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa la 'dod pa'i don phyogs yin zhes pa skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: The position is the desired object in the analysis.

original: de'i phyir @150b phyogs kho na yin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa dam bca' nyid du rtogs par bya'i phyogs ma yin pa ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir @150b phyogs kho na yin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa dam bca' nyid du rtogs par bya'i phyogs ma yin pa ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thesis is understood to be the statement of the probandum, which is the position alone, and not the statement of the reason, etc., which are not the position.

original: de la 'ang zhes pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la 'ang zhes pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the characteristic of the position.

original: de ni mi 'dod pa bzlog pa la dpyad zin pa'i don can zhes pa la 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa bzlog pa la dpyad zin pa'i don can zhes pa la 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in regard to the meaning of what has already been analyzed in the reversal of what is not accepted.

original: phyogs kyi sgra ni spyi sgra yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: phyogs kyi sgra ni spyi sgra yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the word ‚Äúposition‚Äù is a general term,

original: rnam par dpyod pa na mi 'dod pa ma yin pa dgag pas cung zad 'dod pa /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa na mi 'dod pa ma yin pa dgag pas cung zad 'dod pa /
translated: when analyzed, it is the mere desire of what is not not-desired.

original: ji snyed pa de thams cad shes par byed la /
analyzed: ji snyed pa de thams cad shes par byed la /
translated: To the extent that it is all that is known,

original: de kho na la nye bar sbyor ba nus pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na la nye bar sbyor ba nus pa ste /
translated: it is capable of being applied to that alone.

original: ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i bye brag rtogs par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i bye brag rtogs par byed ces pa'o //
translated: It is what causes the understanding of the particular probandum.

original: 'o na rnam par dpyod ba na 'dod pa zhes pa ni byung zin pa'i don gyi yul can brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par dpyod ba na 'dod pa zhes pa ni byung zin pa'i don gyi yul can brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Now, is not ‚Äúdesire‚Äù in the analysis a statement that has as its object a meaning that has already arisen?

original: de'i tshe ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa na 'dod pa'ang ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa na 'dod pa'ang ma yin pas /
translated: At that time, when analyzing the reason and so on that are not established, it is not accepted.

original: de phyogs nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de phyogs nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not a position.

original: des na ci'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yin zhes na /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yin zhes na /
translated: So why is this a consequence?

original: 'di ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lan ma yin te /
translated: This is not an answer.

original: de ltar ni dus gsum pa'i yul can bya ba'i rkyen dang 'brel ba'i phyir phyogs kyi sgra 'das pa'i dus kho na la 'jug par 'thob pa ma yin pas so zhes pa 'di ni ming du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar ni dus gsum pa'i yul can bya ba'i rkyen dang 'brel ba'i phyir phyogs kyi sgra 'das pa'i dus kho na la 'jug par 'thob pa ma yin pas so zhes pa 'di ni ming du bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúposition‚Äù is not obtained as applying only to the past tense, because the subject of the three times is connected with the condition of action. This has already been explained as a name.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa na 'dod par 'gyur ba la yang phyogs kyi sgra 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa na 'dod par 'gyur ba la yang phyogs kyi sgra 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, when analyzed, the term ‚Äúposition‚Äù also applies to what is accepted.

original: de bya ba'i mtha' dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dod par 'gyur ba la 'ang 'jug pa de nyid kyang ston pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bya ba'i mtha' dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dod par 'gyur ba la 'ang 'jug pa de nyid kyang ston pa gsungs so //
translated: Because it is connected with the end of action, it also applies to what is accepted. That itself is taught.

original: nus pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPotency‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs pa can rnams la ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams la ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the NaiyƒÅyikas‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir de'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa las dam bca' 'gal ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir de'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa las dam bca' 'gal ba zhes bshad de /
translated: Here, because it contradicts the meaning of that, it is explained as a thesis that is contradictory due to being a mere designation.

original: thams cad mi rtag ba nyid na ni /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag ba nyid na ni /
translated: If everything is impermanent,

original: sgra thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gal lo //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gal lo //
translated: then it contradicts permanence because it is included within all sounds.

original: gnyis ka'ang yang dag pa ma yin no zhe pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'am yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'ang yang dag pa ma yin no zhe pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'am yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Both are not real.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is not so, etc.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is shown:

original: gal te sgra rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i ched du thams cad mi rtag pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgra rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i ched du thams cad mi rtag pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par gyur na /
translated: If everything is impermanent were stated as a reason in order to prove that sound is permanent,

original: de'i tshe des sgra rtag pa nyid bsal bas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe des sgra rtag pa nyid bsal bas na /
translated: then, since that would eliminate sound being permanent,

original: dam bca' ba gtan tshigs dang 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba gtan tshigs dang 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: the thesis would contradict the reason.

original: 'di ni de lta'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta'ang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is not so, etc.

original: yang @151a * //
analyzed: yang @151a * //
translated: Again,

original: ci ltar na 'di gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'di gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is this not a syllogistic argument?

original: gang gi phyir thams cad mi rtag pa nyid la ni /üîΩdper brjod dang chos mthun pa nyid las bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid las zhes pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad mi rtag pa nyid la ni / dper brjod dang chos mthun pa nyid las bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid las zhes pa /
translated: Because in the case of all impermanent things,

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: the definition of a logical reason is not tenable as either an example of the similar class or an example of the dissimilar class.

original: de ltar ni khyad par sgra kho na la 'gal ba'i chos rtag pa nyid brjod nas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni khyad par sgra kho na la 'gal ba'i chos rtag pa nyid brjod nas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid phyir zhe na /
translated: In this way, having stated the contradictory property of sound, which is a specific instance, that it is permanent, one might think that the reason proves the property to be proven, that all are impermanent.

original: thams cad du spyir bsgrub par bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni sgra la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du spyir bsgrub par bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni sgra la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: But the impermanence that is the general property to be proven is not based on sound.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par skabs su byas pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par skabs su byas pa la /
translated: Because when a specific instance is taken as the subject,

original: phyis spyi sgrub pa ni khyad par de la khyab pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis spyi sgrub pa ni khyad par de la khyab pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the general property that is to be proven later does not pervade that specific instance.

original: 'on kyang skabs su bab pa'i khyad par spangs pas gzhan thams cad la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang skabs su bab pa'i khyad par spangs pas gzhan thams cad la 'jug ste /
translated: However, by excluding the specific instance that is the subject, it is applied to all other instances.

original: dper na kun di na'i bu la dar ba byin la /
analyzed: dper na kun di na'i bu la dar ba byin la /
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúGive curd to the son of Kunti,

original: bram ze rnams la zho byin zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: bram ze rnams la zho byin zhes brjod pa na /
translated: and give yogurt to the brahmans,‚Äù

original: kun di na'i bu la zho sbyin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun di na'i bu la zho sbyin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that yogurt is given to the son of Kunti.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it then?

original: de las tha dad pa'i bram ze rnams la'o//
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i bram ze rnams la'o//
translated: It is given to the brahmans who are different from him.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
translated: It is the same here.

original: de'i phyir sgra la thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde'i de ni dper brjod pa 'ga' zhig dang chos mthun pa nyid dam mi mthun pa nyid ma yin zhing dper brjod dang chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las kyang gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par byed par 'dod do zhes pas gtan tshigs kyi
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra la thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir / de'i de ni dper brjod pa 'ga' zhig dang chos mthun pa nyid dam mi mthun pa nyid ma yin zhing dper brjod dang chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las kyang gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par byed par 'dod do zhes pas gtan tshigs kyi
translated: Therefore, because the word has impermanence in all cases,üîΩit is not that the example is similar to some property or dissimilar. And it is not that the reason proves the probandum from similarity to the example or dissimilarity to the example.

original: mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a correct definition of the reason.

original: nged kyi lugs kyis kyang phyogs chos med pa nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: nged kyi lugs kyis kyang phyogs chos med pa nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: In our system, the definition of the reason is also untenable because the property of the subject does not exist.

original: 'on kyang chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis dpe'i sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni de'i mtshan nyid cung zad bsten pa'i phyir ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis dpe'i sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni de'i mtshan nyid cung zad bsten pa'i phyir ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar ni thams cad ma yin pa'i sgra dang / thams cad bum pa la sogs pa thams cad nyid du chos mi mthun pa nyid yod la /
analyzed: de ltar ni thams cad ma yin pa'i sgra dang / thams cad bum pa la sogs pa thams cad nyid du chos mi mthun pa nyid yod la /
translated: Thus, the word not all and all, all pots, etc., have the dissimilarity.

original: bsgrub byas chos mi mthun pa las kyang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: bsgrub byas chos mi mthun pa las kyang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: And the example is by way of dissimilarity from the probandum.

original: bsgrub byas chos mthun pa las de'i chos rtogs pa'i dpe ni dper brjod de /
analyzed: bsgrub byas chos mthun pa las de'i chos rtogs pa'i dpe ni dper brjod de /
translated: The example of understanding that property from the similar property of the probandum is the example of the illustration.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa las so zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa las so zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that it is the same way by way of dissimilarity.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpes kyang khyed bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun phyogs dag gi ltan cig 'byung ba 'chad pa de yang 'dir yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpes kyang khyed bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun phyogs dag gi ltan cig 'byung ba 'chad pa de yang 'dir yod pa kho na'o //
translated: And the example of dissimilarity also explains the co-occurrence of the probandum and the reason in your case. That also exists here.

original: de ltar ni sgra rtag la /
analyzed: de ltar ni sgra rtag la /
translated: Thus, sound is permanent.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes @151b brjod pa na /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes @151b brjod pa na /
translated: When it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the impermanence of all,‚Äù

original: rtag pa dang thams cad ma yin pa'i mi mthun phyogs dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba rtogs te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang thams cad ma yin pa'i mi mthun phyogs dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba rtogs te /
translated: the co-occurrence of the opposites of permanence and all is understood.

original: thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the understanding that all is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe'i sbyor ba'o zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe'i sbyor ba'o zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the application of the example of the dissimilar reason. This is the point.

original: de la'ang zhes pa la sogs pas pha rol po rnams kyi legs par ma bslabs pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: de la'ang zhes pa la sogs pas pha rol po rnams kyi legs par ma bslabs pa nyid ston te /
translated: In response to that, the following is taught:

original: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'dir mi rtag pa'i sgra rtag pa med pa la 'jug pa ni go sla ba'o zhes pa thams cad kyi sgra kho na thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs med pa la 'jug pa 'chad do //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'dir mi rtag pa'i sgra rtag pa med pa la 'jug pa ni go sla ba'o zhes pa thams cad kyi sgra kho na thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs med pa la 'jug pa 'chad do //
translated: In this case, the word impermanent in the statement, ‚Äúbecause of the impermanence of all,‚Äù is easily understood to refer to the absence of permanence. The word all alone is explained to refer to the absence of a reason for non-all.

original: thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to zhes pa 'dis /
analyzed: thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to zhes pa 'dis /
translated: Because of the absence of non-all. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: thams cad kyi sgras 'dir thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa nye bar mtshon zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgras 'dir thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa nye bar mtshon zhing /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù here indicates the absence of non-all.

original: yul thams cad yul gyi yul can thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad yul gyi yul can thams cad ma yin pa nyid med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Because all objects indicate the absence of non-all objects.

original: de lta na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa brjod pa na /
analyzed: de lta na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa brjod pa na /
translated: In that case, when the absence of the probandum is stated, the absence of the reason is stated.

original: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The reason is stated as the reason for understanding.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not stated in any other way.

original: ji ltar 'di 'di ltar yin pa de ltar phyi nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'di ltar yin pa de ltar phyi nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is like this, later it will be established like this.

original: 'o na 'dir gtan tshigs thams cad ma yin pa nyid thos pa med de /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir gtan tshigs thams cad ma yin pa nyid thos pa med de /
translated: But here the absence of non-all reason is not heard.

original: des na ci ltar de med pa la thams cad kyi sgra 'jug pa rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de med pa la thams cad kyi sgra 'jug pa rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: So how is the application of the word ‚Äúall‚Äù to its absence to be understood?

original: gsungs pa / rtags ni nyer sbyor las 'dir zhes pa /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rtags ni nyer sbyor las 'dir zhes pa /
translated: It is said: The reason is ‚Äúhere‚Äù from the application.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi nye bar sbyor bas 'dir thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi nye bar sbyor bas 'dir thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs gsal bar byas so //
translated: The application of the dissimilar property makes it clear here that the reason is not universal.

original: 'di lta ste bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa ni thams cad yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa ni thams cad yin la /
translated: For example, impermanence is universal for all things such as pots.

original: sgra ni de ltar thams cad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra ni de ltar thams cad ma yin gyi /
translated: But sound is not universal in that way.

original: 'on kyang thams cad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad ma yin pa'o //
translated: Rather, it is not universal.

original: de'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is because it is not universal.

original: de yang ma grub pa ste zhes pa 'di la sgra ni zhes pa la sogs pas 'thad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa ste zhes pa 'di la sgra ni zhes pa la sogs pas 'thad pa gsungs so //
translated: That is not established, he says. Here, he states the rationale with ‚ÄúSound is . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The word all is of two kinds.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa dang yongs su bshad pa can no //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa dang yongs su bshad pa can no //
translated: It is known in the world and it is explained.

original: de la dang po ni ma lus pa'i don la 'jug la /
analyzed: de la dang po ni ma lus pa'i don la 'jug la /
translated: Of those, the first applies to the meaning of the entirety,

original: phyi ma ni nyi tshe ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: phyi ma ni nyi tshe ba la 'jug go //
translated: and the latter applies to the limited.

original: de la re zhig 'jig rten la grags pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'jig rten la grags pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to that, first, he states from the perspective of what is known in the world.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ltar med de zhes pa 'dis sgra la thams cad nyid dang @152a * //
analyzed: ci ltar med de zhes pa 'dis sgra la thams cad nyid dang @152a * //
translated: How is it nonexistent?üîΩ

original: 'gal ba thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi chos smras pas sgra ni thams cad las gzhan nyid du smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba thams cad ma yin pa nyid kyi chos smras pas sgra ni thams cad las gzhan nyid du smras pa ste /
translated: How is it not? He says that the word is contradictory to everything, and not to everything, so he says that sound is different from everything.

original: ma grub pa nyid yongs su spang ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid yongs su spang ba'i ched du'o //
translated: In order to avoid the nonestablishment of the reason, he says,

original: de lta na 'o na zhes pa la sogs pas sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes pa la sogs pas sel bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni dgongs pa ste spyi rnams ni khyad par mi spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni dgongs pa ste spyi rnams ni khyad par mi spong ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the intended meaning: because universals do not exclude particulars,

original: spyi'i sgra ni rang gi khyad par mi gtong gi /'on kyang 'phangs pa kho nas 'jug go //
analyzed: spyi'i sgra ni rang gi khyad par mi gtong gi /'on kyang 'phangs pa kho nas 'jug go //
translated: the word ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù does not exclude its own particulars, but rather engages them by implication.

original: dper na shing gi sgras shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gi sgras shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the word ‚Äútree‚Äù implies the particulars, such as the ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi sgras sgra'ang 'phen no zhes pas sgra ni thams cad kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi sgras sgra'ang 'phen no zhes pas sgra ni thams cad kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúeverything‚Äù implies sound, so sound is everything.

original: gang du'ang ci shing sha pa kho na shing yin nam 'o na te ma yin zhes dris pa la lan brjod pa shing sha pa shing ma yin zhes pa de la'ang /
analyzed: gang du'ang ci shing sha pa kho na shing yin nam 'o na te ma yin zhes dris pa la lan brjod pa shing sha pa shing ma yin zhes pa de la'ang /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúIs a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ the only tree?‚Äù the response is, ‚ÄúA ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not a tree.‚Äù

original: shing sha pa la shing nyid bkag pa las /
analyzed: shing sha pa la shing nyid bkag pa las /
translated: In this, the property of being a tree is refuted in a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: spyis khyad par shing sha pa spangs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyis khyad par shing sha pa spangs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: However, the universal is not abandoned in the particular ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: gang gi phyir shing nyid kyi spyi rnam pa 'dis shing sha ba'i gsal ba gcig la so sor nges par bzlog pa'o //üîΩji ltar yang 'di lta bur skabs 'ga' zhig tu shing sha ba shing ma yin zhes spyi gsal ba gcig la 'jug ba'i nges pa 'gog pa de ltar sgra ni thams cad du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i tshig 'dis 'di ni 'di lta bu gcig la
analyzed: gang gi phyir shing nyid kyi spyi rnam pa 'dis shing sha ba'i gsal ba gcig la so sor nges par bzlog pa'o // ji ltar yang 'di lta bur skabs 'ga' zhig tu shing sha ba shing ma yin zhes spyi gsal ba gcig la 'jug ba'i nges pa 'gog pa de ltar sgra ni thams cad du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i tshig 'dis 'di ni 'di lta bu gcig la
translated: This is because the universal of being a tree is individually ascertained and reversed in the particular instance of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.üîΩThe words ‚ÄúIn some contexts, a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not a tree‚Äù refute the ascertainment that a universal is instantiated in a particular. However, that is not the case with the word all.

original: 'jug pa'i nges pa 'gog pa bya ba yin gyi thams cad nyid sgra la 'jug pa zlog pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i nges pa 'gog pa bya ba yin gyi thams cad nyid sgra la 'jug pa zlog pa ma yin zhing /
translated: This statement refutes the ascertainment that it is instantiated in a particular instance. It does not refute that it is instantiated in all.

original: 'di cam gyis thams cad nyid sgra gcig pu la 'jug pa'i nges pa bkag pa tsam gyis sgra thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di cam gyis thams cad nyid sgra gcig pu la 'jug pa'i nges pa bkag pa tsam gyis sgra thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that by merely refuting the determination that all is subsumed under a single sound, all sounds are not subsumed.

original: ci ste 'di lta bus de thams cad ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di lta bus de thams cad ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: But if it were like this, then all would not be all.

original: de ltan 'on sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i khyad par rnams thams cad kyang so sor thams cad ma yin pa nyid na /
analyzed: de ltan 'on sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i khyad par rnams thams cad kyang so sor thams cad ma yin pa nyid na /
translated: In that case, all the particulars that are not of the nature of sound would also not be all.

original: thams cad yin pa 'ga' yang med par 'gyur zhing 'dod pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yin pa 'ga' yang med par 'gyur zhing 'dod pa'ang yin no //
translated: And so, there would be nothing that is all, and that is also accepted.

original: de'i phyir sgra ni thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ni thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pas /
translated: Therefore, since sound is subsumed within all,

original: de la thams cad ma yin pa nyid ma grub bo //üîΩ'o na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la thams cad ma yin pa nyid ma grub bo // 'o na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: it is not established that it is not all.

original: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pas /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pas /
translated: Now, if you say, ‚ÄúAll things are impermanent,‚Äù

original: dam bca' ba'i rtag pa nyid sel ba'i phyir rang gi tshig gis gnod pa smras pa'am /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i rtag pa nyid sel ba'i phyir rang gi tshig gis gnod pa smras pa'am /
translated: since the thesis of permanence is refuted, you are undermined by your own words.

original: yang na khas blangs pas gnod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na khas blangs pas gnod pa ste /
translated: Or, you are undermined by your own acceptance.

original: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas sgra rtag pa nyid sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas sgra rtag pa nyid sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of accepting that all things are impermanent, sound's permanence is eliminated.üîΩ Sound's permanence is eliminated by the reason because of being a product, and sound's impermanence is eliminated by the reason because of being a product.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.

original: sgra la gnas pa nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩchos can gcig la chos 'gal ba nye bar @152b sdud na gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste / chos can gcig la chos 'gal ba nye bar @152b sdud na gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.

original: 'dir ni dar ba dang kun di na'i bu'i rigs pas sgra las gzhan la mi rtag pa nyid brjod de /üîΩgang gsungs pa thams cad la gnas pa brjod par bya ba na zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni dar ba dang kun di na'i bu'i rigs pas sgra las gzhan la mi rtag pa nyid brjod de / gang gsungs pa thams cad la gnas pa brjod par bya ba na zhes pa ste /
translated: The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.

original: sgra ma gtogs pa'i thams cad gang yin pa de la gnas pa brjod par bya ba zhes pa dgongs pa'o //üîΩde ltar 'gyur mod gal te 'jig rten la grags pa'i thams cad mngon par brjod par gyur na thams cad ma yin pa nyid ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra ma gtogs pa'i thams cad gang yin pa de la gnas pa brjod par bya ba zhes pa dgongs pa'o // de ltar 'gyur mod gal te 'jig rten la grags pa'i thams cad mngon par brjod par gyur na thams cad ma yin pa nyid ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.

original: thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.üîΩ The statement because of being a product is a reason that eliminates both permanence and impermanence.

original: gang gi tshe yongs su bshad pa can yin pa de'i tshe ci ltar ma grub pa yin zhes dgongs pa byas nas yongs su bshad pa can gyi thams cad kyi sgra'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /üîΩci ste zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yongs su bshad pa can yin pa de'i tshe ci ltar ma grub pa yin zhes dgongs pa byas nas yongs su bshad pa can gyi thams cad kyi sgra'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa / ci ste zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
