analyzed: byas pa mi rtag ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rtag pa ni ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dam bca'i de ma thag tu lnga pa'i mtha' can thob pa'i phyir phyogs chos med kyang 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Immediately after the thesis, because of the acquisition of the ending of the fifth case, even though the property of the subject does not exist, this is the reason.

original: de las kyang gtan tshigs phyogs chos kho na'o zhes pa 'di mi rigs zhes kha cig phyin ci log tu byed de /
analyzed: de las kyang gtan tshigs phyogs chos kho na'o zhes pa 'di mi rigs zhes kha cig phyin ci log tu byed de /
translated: Also, from that, some perversely think that this is not correct, that the reason is only the property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi phyin ci log bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi phyin ci log bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove their perversity, it is said:

original: phyogs chos kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs chos kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The property of the subject and also...

original: gang du rtags bsgrub bya rjes 'gro //
analyzed: gang du rtags bsgrub bya rjes 'gro //
translated: Where the reason follows the probandum.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i snga ma phyed kyis dpe gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i snga ma phyed kyis dpe gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs so //
translated: The first half of this verse states the definition of the two examples.

original: gang du dang der gyi sgra dag gis sbyor ba nges par bstan to //
analyzed: gang du dang der gyi sgra dag gis sbyor ba nges par bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúwhere‚Äù and ‚Äúthere‚Äù indicate the certainty of the application.

original: rkang pa gsum pas ni lnga pa'i mtha' 'di ni dpe'i sbyor ba kho nar rig par bya'i gtan tshigs ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di shes par byas so //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas ni lnga pa'i mtha' 'di ni dpe'i sbyor ba kho nar rig par bya'i gtan tshigs ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di shes par byas so //
translated: The third line makes it understood that this end of the fifth verse is to be known only as the application of the example, not as the reason.

original: bzhi pas ni der ji ltar gtan tshigs 'thob ba de @158b ltar bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni der ji ltar gtan tshigs 'thob ba de @158b ltar bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: The fourth line explains how the reason is obtained there.

original: 'di la phyogs chos nyid yod pa ma yin te zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'di la phyogs chos nyid yod pa ma yin te zhes brjod pa na /
translated: Here, when it is said that ‚Äúthe property of the subject does not exist,‚Äù

original: pha rol pos gtan tshigs phyogs chos med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig gi sems so zhes pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: pha rol pos gtan tshigs phyogs chos med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig gi sems so zhes pas gsungs pa /
translated: some think that the opponent says that the reason is the nonexistence of the property of the subject.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid kyang srid do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid kyang srid do zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúthe definition of the example is also possible.‚Äù

original: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba dpes 'chad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba dpes 'chad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, isn‚Äôt the invariable concomitance of the reason explained by means of an example?

original: 'dir gtan tshigs thos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs thos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, the reason is not heard.

original: des na ci ltar 'di dpe'i sbyor ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'di dpe'i sbyor ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: So how is this an application of an example?

original: gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar las 'dod //üîΩces pa'o // 'o na 'di phyogs chos med pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar las 'dod // ces pa'o // 'o na 'di phyogs chos med pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: It is asserted from the application of the reason.

original: gsal pa ni med pa skye ba ma yin te tha dad du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tha dad du thal ba ni gsal ba'i chos ma yin pas so zhe na gsungs pa /üîΩrgyu med par ni thal 'gyur pa //
analyzed: gsal pa ni med pa skye ba ma yin te tha dad du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tha dad du thal ba ni gsal ba'i chos ma yin pas so zhe na gsungs pa / rgyu med par ni thal 'gyur pa //
translated: Well, this is a reason that lacks the property of the subject, because the arising of the nonexistent is not clear, because of the consequence of difference. The consequence of difference is not a property of the clear.üîΩThe Consequentialists do not assert that.

original: zhes so // rgyu ste rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni tha dad pa yin zhing der thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu ste rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni tha dad pa yin zhing der thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cause, the forward pervasion, is difference, and that is the consequence.

original: gang du zhes pa ni bstan bcos su'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes pa ni bstan bcos su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere?‚Äù refers to the treatise.

original: de ni dpe gnyis las grub phyir //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: de ni dpe gnyis las grub phyir //üîΩzhes pa la /
translated: Because it is established from two examples.

original: gang la mthong ba mtha' ste nges byed yin pa'o zhes pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis po 'dir dpe'i sgras brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang la mthong ba mtha' ste nges byed yin pa'o zhes pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis po 'dir dpe'i sgras brjod par 'dod de /
translated: The word example is intended to express both the positive and negative concomitances, as in where there is seeing, there is an end, which is a determination.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the probandum is established from the two, the positive and negative concomitances, that is the meaning.

original: de las kyang rnam par ldan pa las bsal te 'ongs pa tha dad pa ma yin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang rnam par ldan pa las bsal te 'ongs pa tha dad pa ma yin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: From that, it is intended that exclusion is not different from coming.

original: bsal te 'ongs pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsal te 'ongs pas zhes pa ni /
translated: The word exclusion is explained as follows:

original: gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pas rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed pa ni bsal te 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pas rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed pa ni bsal te 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of one's own position by negating the position of another is exclusion.

original: bsal ba ni zhes pa la sogs pas da'  sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: bsal ba ni zhes pa la sogs pas da'  sbyor ba ston to //
translated: The statement beginning with exclusion shows the application of the word exclusion.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs bas dpe gnyis las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod bar bya'o zhes rtogs par byed cing rnam par gzhan sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs bas dpe gnyis las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod bar bya'o zhes rtogs par byed cing rnam par gzhan sel bar byed do //
translated: There, beginning with that, it is understood that the consequence of the absence of a reason should be stated because the probandum is established from the two examples, and the other is excluded.

original: rnam ba gzhan ni med pa sngon ma can rnams kyi tha dad pa mthong bar yang 'gyur ba ste gang med pa sngon ma can de tha dad pa dmigs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam ba gzhan ni med pa sngon ma can rnams kyi tha dad pa mthong bar yang 'gyur ba ste gang med pa sngon ma can de tha dad pa dmigs so zhes pa'o //
translated: The other aspect is that the difference of those that have a prior nonexistence is seen, that is, that which has a prior nonexistence is observed to be different.

original: yang na de rnams kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba las bzlog pa sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de rnams kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba las bzlog pa sgrub pa ste /
translated: Or, the proof is from the nonseeing of their concomitance.

original: gang med pa sngon ma can de'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang med pa sngon ma can de'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: That which has a prior nonexistence is not seen to be concomitant.

original: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa tha dad bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa tha dad bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the opposite of that, difference, follows.

original: gnyis ka ltar na yang mi @159a * //üîΩ'thad de / re zhig med pa sngon ma can gyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig rnams dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar na yang mi @159a * // 'thad de / re zhig med pa sngon ma can gyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig rnams dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In both cases, it is not tenable.

original: de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the difference of those that have a prior nonexistence is not observed because they do not exist.üîΩThe concomitance of those that have a prior nonexistence is not seen.

original: med pa snga ma can gyi tha dad pa rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma yin no zhes med pa sngon ma can nyid khas len pa na /
analyzed: med pa snga ma can gyi tha dad pa rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma yin no zhes med pa sngon ma can nyid khas len pa na /
translated: When you accept that they have a prior nonexistence,

original: rjes su 'gro ba las bzlog bas tha dad par thal bar byed pa rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba las bzlog bas tha dad par thal bar byed pa rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not logical to make the consequence of difference from the opposite of the subsequent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa /
analyzed: mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa /
translated: Because of the undesirable consequence.

original: gal te ma mthong ba las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs par byed na /
translated: If one imputes the opposite of non-seeing,

original: tha dad pa yang 'di rnams la mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas de las bzlog pa yang 'thob bo zhes pa 'di ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang 'di rnams la mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas de las bzlog pa yang 'thob bo zhes pa 'di ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: then difference is also not seen in these, and therefore the opposite of that is also obtained. This is undesirable.

original: gal te de ltar tha dad bar thal bar 'gyur ba de mi rigs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tha dad bar thal bar 'gyur ba de mi rigs na /
translated: If the consequence of difference in that way is not logical,

original: 'o na rigs pa de ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na rigs pa de ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: then what is the logical [reasoning]? It is said,

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Well then, what is it? and so forth.

original: 'dis rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed do //
translated: This establishes one's own position.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid la gyo mo la sogs pa la mthong la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid la gyo mo la sogs pa la mthong la /
translated: Because the subsequent is only that which has the prior, and it is seen in the pot and so forth.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba ston to //
translated: This teaches the subsequent.

original: de med pa la yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de med pa la yang ma mthong ste /
translated: It is also not seen in the absence of that.

original: rgyu gcig pa nyid med pa la yang sna tshogs pa snga ma can rnams la'am med pa snga ma can rnams la ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gcig pa nyid med pa la yang sna tshogs pa snga ma can rnams la'am med pa snga ma can rnams la ma mthong ngo //
translated: And the diversity is not seen in the absence of a single cause, either in those that have a prior cause or in those that do not have a prior cause.

original: 'dis kyang ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang ldog pa'o //
translated: This also is a contraposition.

original: de'i phyir gcig sngon ma can nyid do zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar rigs gcig rjes su 'gro ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid kyis khyab pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig sngon ma can nyid do zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar rigs gcig rjes su 'gro ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid kyis khyab pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the single cause is prior, because in that way, the pervasion of the single cause is by the prior cause.

original: gsal ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba ni gcig sngon ma can nyid do //
translated: The manifestation is the single cause.

original: des khas mi len na yang zhes pa khyab par byed pa gcig sngon ma can de khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: des khas mi len na yang zhes pa khyab par byed pa gcig sngon ma can de khas mi len na'o //
translated: Even though it is not accepted, if the single cause that is the pervader is not accepted,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur zhes pa khyab bar bya ba rjes su 'gro ba med bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /üîΩkhyab par byed pa ldog pa ni khyab par bya ba ldog par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur zhes pa khyab bar bya ba rjes su 'gro ba med bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te / khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni khyab par bya ba ldog par byed de /
translated: there is the consequence of the absence of pervasion, that is, the pervaded is without pervasion.

original: gzhan du na de de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The reversal of the pervader is the reversal of the pervaded, because otherwise it would not be the pervader of that.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par thal ba de yang med do zhes thal par 'gyur ba bzlog pas rjes su 'gro ba de nyid bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par thal ba de yang med do zhes thal par 'gyur ba bzlog pas rjes su 'gro ba de nyid bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: The pervasion itself is stated by the reversal of the absurd consequence.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir tha dad pa rnams ni rgyu gcig sngon ma can rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir tha dad pa rnams ni rgyu gcig sngon ma can rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of the pervasion, different things have a single cause.

original: de'i phyir ldan las tha dad min //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan las tha dad min //
translated: Therefore, it is not different from possession.

original: zhes pa gang gi phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi phyir /
translated: Because of that.

original: 'dir yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i stobs las thal 'gyur du bsgrubs nas de bzlog pas rjes su 'gro ba kho na brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i stobs las thal 'gyur du bsgrubs nas de bzlog pas rjes su 'gro ba kho na brjod de /
translated: Here also, having proven the reductio by the power of the pervasion and reversal, the pervasion itself is stated by the reversal of that.

original: 'di la khyad bar ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'di la khyad bar ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the difference between this and that?

original: ces pa'o// @159b sbyor ba kho na tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ste don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ces pa'o// @159b sbyor ba kho na tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ste don ni ma yin no //
translated: The only difference is in the expression, not in the meaning.

original: de ltar bsal te 'ongs pa la yang thal 'gyur dang bzlog bas phyogs kyi chos brjod ba'o zhes pas 'gar yang phyogs kyi chos med pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsal te 'ongs pa la yang thal 'gyur dang bzlog bas phyogs kyi chos brjod ba'o zhes pas 'gar yang phyogs kyi chos med pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: Having thus cleared away the objection, the property of the subject is stated by the reductio and its reversal. Therefore, the reason is never devoid of the property of the subject.

original: de ci ltar bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin zhes te /
analyzed: de ci ltar bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin zhes te /
translated: How is it that it is not cleared away?

original: rnam par ldan pa las bsal te 'ongs pa tha mi dad par brjod pas bsal te 'ongs pa yang phyogs chos nyid do zhes bshad cing /
analyzed: rnam par ldan pa las bsal te 'ongs pa tha mi dad par brjod pas bsal te 'ongs pa yang phyogs chos nyid do zhes bshad cing /
translated: The reply is that the property of the subject is the mere coming from what has been excluded, because it is said that the coming from what has been excluded is not different from the mere coming.

original: 'di bsal te 'ongs par srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bsal te 'ongs par srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not possible that this is a coming from what has been excluded.

original: bsal te 'ongs pas ni gtan tshigs med par rtsod la /
analyzed: bsal te 'ongs pas ni gtan tshigs med par rtsod la /
translated: Because a coming from what has been excluded is a dispute without a reason,

original: 'dir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ma yin no //
translated: but this is not so.

original: longs spyod pa po dang longs spyad par bya ba dag ni yon tan med pa nyid dam yon tan nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: longs spyod pa po dang longs spyad par bya ba dag ni yon tan med pa nyid dam yon tan nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: The experiencer and the experienced are not without qualities or not qualities.

original: rdzas ma yin pa nyid dam rdzas nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa nyid dam rdzas nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not substances or not substances.

original: yon tan dang rdzas rnams yod pa nyid la gtan tshigs bshad de /
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas rnams yod pa nyid la gtan tshigs bshad de /
translated: The reason is explained in the existence of qualities and substances.

original: gang las de med par thal bas gtan tshigs med par rtsod pa las 'di bsal te 'ongs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang las de med par thal bas gtan tshigs med par rtsod pa las 'di bsal te 'ongs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it follows that they do not exist, the dispute is without a reason, but this is a coming from what has been excluded.

original: 'di gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is also not a nonreason.

original: des na gtan tshigs phyogs chos kho na'o zhes pa 'di 'thad pa ma yin zhe'o //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs phyogs chos kho na'o zhes pa 'di 'thad pa ma yin zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the reason is only the property of the subject.

original: 'di ni bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a case of a rebuttal.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it so? It is stated:

original: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of the property of the subject in the case of a rebuttal.

original: bsal te 'ongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos so zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: bsal te 'ongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos so zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: The property of the subject in the case of a rebuttal has already been established.

original: sbyor ba 'di ni gang gi phyir phyogs chos med nyid phyir bsal te 'ongs pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ni gang gi phyir phyogs chos med nyid phyir bsal te 'ongs pa las gzhan no //
translated: This application is: because of the absence of the property of the subject in the case of a rebuttal, it is different from a rebuttal.

original: de'i phyir 'di bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bsal te 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a case of a rebuttal.

original: 'o na 'di ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well then, what is it? It is stated:

original: sun 'byin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin zhes pa'o //
translated: A refutation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it so? It is stated:

original: rtags dang dam bca' dag gi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rtags dang dam bca' dag gi zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of the reason and the thesis.

original: yang ci ltar 'di sun 'byin no zhes shes par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang ci ltar 'di sun 'byin no zhes shes par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, how is it to be understood that this is a refutation? It is stated:

original: skyon brjod pas zhes pa ste skyon bsal bar byed pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyon brjod pas zhes pa ste skyon bsal bar byed pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By stating the faults, meaning by removing the faults.

original: brjod pa'i sgra 'dir dngos po sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra 'dir dngos po sgrub pa'o //
translated: In this expression, the term stating is used to establish the entity.

original: skyon brjod pa de yang snga ma khas blangs pa yod na 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skyon brjod pa de yang snga ma khas blangs pa yod na 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di bshad pa ni /
translated: And that statement of faults is only possible if there is prior acceptance. This is explained:

original: snga mar khas blangs pa yod na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snga mar khas blangs pa yod na zhes pa'o //
translated: If there is an assertion of the former.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: sun 'byin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyogs snga ma rgol pas khas blangs pa'i don 'ga' zhig sun 'byin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyogs snga ma rgol pas khas blangs pa'i don 'ga' zhig sun 'byin par bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúRefutation‚Äù is that which refutes some object that is asserted by the opponent.

original: de'i tshig ni sun 'byin no //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni sun 'byin no //
translated: Its words are the refutation.

original: snga mas khas blangs pa'i skyon bsal bar byed ba ni de'i 'bras bu ste /üîΩde'i phyir 'bras bu des 'di sun @160a * //
analyzed: snga mas khas blangs pa'i skyon bsal bar byed ba ni de'i 'bras bu ste / de'i phyir 'bras bu des 'di sun @160a * //
translated: The removal of the fault asserted by the former is its effect.

original: 'byin no zhes nges par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'byin no zhes nges par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should ascertain that ‚Äúthis refutes that‚Äù by means of that effect.

original: gtan tshigs ci zhig gis 'di sun 'byin yin zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ci zhig gis 'di sun 'byin yin zhen gsungs pa /
translated: By what reason does this refute that?

original: 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHere, the reason . . .‚Äù

original: gtso bo yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni yon tan rjes su 'gro ba ste /üîΩgtso bo yod de /
analyzed: gtso bo yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni yon tan rjes su 'gro ba ste / gtso bo yod de /
translated: The reason for the existence of the primary nature is the property of following after the qualities.

original: khyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: The primary nature exists because the particulars are seen to follow after it.

original: de yang gzhan gyi ngor ma grub ste /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi ngor ma grub ste /
translated: Moreover, that is not established for the other.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi rjes su song ba nyid du khyad par rnams yid ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi rjes su song ba nyid du khyad par rnams yid ches pa ma yin no //
translated: The Buddhists do not accept that the differences among the gunas, sattva, etc., are due to the presence of the other gunas.

original: de'i phyir de rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du grangs can pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid gtan tshigs su bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du grangs can pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid gtan tshigs su bshad do //
translated: Therefore, in order to prove that, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya explains that the effect is the same as the cause.

original: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ste lnga rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa ste gsum po rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ste lnga rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa ste gsum po rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The five, sound, touch, form, taste, and smell, are the differences in the arrangement of the three, pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lnga po rnams kyi dang lnga po rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyi dang lnga po rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five have the same effect as the five.

original: sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rab tu dang ba dang yang ba nyid dang rab tu dag pa dang mngon bar chags pa dang mchog tu rangs ba dang dga' ba rnams so //
analyzed: sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rab tu dang ba dang yang ba nyid dang rab tu dag pa dang mngon bar chags pa dang mchog tu rangs ba dang dga' ba rnams so //
translated: The effects of sound, touch, form, taste, and smell are clarity, lightness, purity, attachment, and supreme joy and pleasure, respectively.

original: sdug bsngal rnams kyi ni mya ngan dang gdung ba dang zug gzer dang rengs pa dang yid 'byung ba dang zhe sdang ba rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams kyi ni mya ngan dang gdung ba dang zug gzer dang rengs pa dang yid 'byung ba dang zhe sdang ba rnams so //
translated: For those who are suffering, there is grief, distress, pain, paralysis, disgust, and aversion.

original: rmongs pa rnams kyi ni 'gebs pa dang 'byin pa dang 'jig pa dang mi sdug pa nyid dang zhum pa nyid dang lci ba nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams kyi ni 'gebs pa dang 'byin pa dang 'jig pa dang mi sdug pa nyid dang zhum pa nyid dang lci ba nyid rnams so //
translated: For those who are confused, there is obscuration, delusion, destruction, ugliness, depression, and heaviness.

original: de rnams ni lnga rnams dang lnga rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig par 'gyur pa mthong nas sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ste lnga po rnams /
analyzed: de rnams ni lnga rnams dang lnga rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig par 'gyur pa mthong nas sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro dang dri ste lnga po rnams /
translated: Seeing that these five and the five are the same result, sound, touch, form, taste, and smell,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug ste gsum po rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par ro zhes 'dzin bar byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug ste gsum po rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par ro zhes 'dzin bar byed do //
translated: are grasped as the particular arrangement of the three: pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: des na khas blangs ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des na khas blangs ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúone accepts‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yin pa de ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gang gi rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yin pa de ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That which has faith and so on as its result is the nature of pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin yul gyi dngos por gnas pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i yang rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yin no zhes pa 'bras bu'i gzugs brnyan gyis sgrub par byed pa 'di khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin yul gyi dngos por gnas pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i yang rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yin no zhes pa 'bras bu'i gzugs brnyan gyis sgrub par byed pa 'di khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be accepted that the effect is the clear-minded state, etc., of the cow, etc., which exist as real entities of the object, just like pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar na za ba po la'ang thal bar 'gyur ba 'phyir ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na za ba po la'ang thal bar 'gyur ba 'phyir ma nges pa ste /
translated: Thus, the consequence that the experiencer would be the effect is not definite.

original: de ltar ni skyes bu rang bzhin dang bral ba yang bsgoms pa las drang srong @160b ser skya'i ni rab tu dang ba la sogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar ni skyes bu rang bzhin dang bral ba yang bsgoms pa las drang srong @160b ser skya'i ni rab tu dang ba la sogs par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, even a person who is devoid of intrinsic reality would have a clear-minded state, etc., from meditation on the sage Kapila.

original: de las gzhan rnams kyi ni mya ngan la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams kyi ni mya ngan la sogs par ro //
translated: From that, others would have sorrow, etc.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that the person would have the intrinsic reality of pleasure, etc.

original: khas mi len na yang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid ma nges pa nyid du gsal bar byed cing ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'i 'bras bu ston par byed do //
analyzed: khas mi len na yang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid ma nges pa nyid du gsal bar byed cing ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'i 'bras bu ston par byed do //
translated: If you do not accept this, then the statement that it is not definite is clarified, and the consequence of the statement that it is not definite is shown.

original: 'am gyi sgra ni gtan tshigs la'o //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ni gtan tshigs la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the root text indicates an alternative.

original: 'di bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang gi phyir rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin yang skyes bu bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin yang skyes bu bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du khas ma blangs te /
translated: Even though the results of clear faith and so on are accepted as being the happiness of a person and so on, they are not accepted as having the nature of happiness and so on.

original: de'i phyir de khas mi len na longs spyad par bya ba yang yon tan ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de khas mi len na longs spyad par bya ba yang yon tan ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, if you do not accept that, then the object of enjoyment is not a quality.

original: de'i phyir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs yon tan rjes su 'gro ba ni ma grub pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs yon tan rjes su 'gro ba ni ma grub pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the root reason, that the qualities are not established, is not established.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: skyes bu ni mthong ba nyid med de /
analyzed: skyes bu ni mthong ba nyid med de /
translated: a person is not seen.

original: des na ci'i phyir de mthong ba la rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir de mthong ba la rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed ce na /
translated: Therefore, why does the result of clear faith and so on arise from seeing it?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rab tu dang ba dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rab tu dang ba dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the result of clear faith and sorrow and so on is seen in the case of an unseen object that is inferred.

original: de ltar ni grang bas nyen pa du ba mthong ba las me nges pa ni dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni grang bas nyen pa du ba mthong ba las me nges pa ni dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, when a person who is suffering from the cold sees smoke, he ascertains fire and feels pleasure.

original: stag gi sgra thos pa las stag thag nye bar rjes su dpag ba la yongs su gdung bar ro //
analyzed: stag gi sgra thos pa las stag thag nye bar rjes su dpag ba la yongs su gdung bar ro //
translated: When he hears the sound of a tiger, he infers that a tiger is nearby and feels anxiety.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu rjes su dpag pa'i yang rab tu dang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu rjes su dpag pa'i yang rab tu dang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, when he infers a person, he feels faith and so on.

original: bdag gis skyes bu nges bar bya ste ring po mi thogs bar thar ba nyid thob bar 'gyur ro zhes sems pa'i'o //
analyzed: bdag gis skyes bu nges bar bya ste ring po mi thogs bar thar ba nyid thob bar 'gyur ro zhes sems pa'i'o //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI will ascertain a person and will soon attain liberation.‚Äù

original: ci ste rjes su dpag pa'i yul du yang 'gyur ba ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rjes su dpag pa'i yul du yang 'gyur ba ma yin na ni /
translated: But if a person is not the object of inference,

original: 'o na de yod do zhes ci ltar nges par bya /
analyzed: 'o na de yod do zhes ci ltar nges par bya /
translated: how can one ascertain that he exists?

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the composition of the treatise would be pointless,

original: bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu ni skyes bu thar pa'i thabs sgrub pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu ni skyes bu thar pa'i thabs sgrub pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the purpose of the treatise is to establish the means for a person to attain liberation.

original: 'o na yang skyes bu nye bar sems pa can gyi gzugs brnyan bsgrub pa'i yid kho na rab tu dang ba la sogs pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na yang skyes bu nye bar sems pa can gyi gzugs brnyan bsgrub pa'i yid kho na rab tu dang ba la sogs pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt you say that the reflection of the person who is the object of the mind is clearly manifest in the clear mind and so on?

original: de yang gtso bo can nyid kyi phyir yon tan gsum kho na'o zhes pas /
analyzed: de yang gtso bo can nyid kyi phyir yon tan gsum kho na'o zhes pas /
translated: And since that reflection has a principal, it is the three gunas alone.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu ma nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu ma nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the person not ascertained?

original: 'di ni gtam ste /üîΩskyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes na skyes bu nye ba'i sems pa can gyi yid do zhes ci las nges pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni gtam ste / skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes na skyes bu nye ba'i sems pa can gyi yid do zhes ci las nges pa yin /
translated: This is a mere assertion.

original: rgya skyegs la @161a * //
analyzed: rgya skyegs la @161a * //
translated: If the nature of the person is not known, how can you ascertain that the mind of the person who is the object of the mind is clear?

original: sogs pa 'gegs par byed pa nges par ma bcad na ni /
analyzed: sogs pa 'gegs par byed pa nges par ma bcad na ni /
translated: If the obstruction of lac and so on is not ascertained,

original: des bkab pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag shel la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des bkab pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag shel la sogs pa la /
translated: then the particular form that is covered by it, such as crystal,

original: rgya skyegs la sogs pas bkab pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag go zhes nges par nus pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgya skyegs la sogs pas bkab pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag go zhes nges par nus pa ma yin pas so //
translated: cannot be ascertained as the particular form covered by lac and so on.

original: gal te yang skyes bu nye ba na yid ni sems pa can gyi gzugs brnyan thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang skyes bu nye ba na yid ni sems pa can gyi gzugs brnyan thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the mind of the person who is the object of the mind obtains the reflection of the person who is near,

original: rtag tu 'gyur te skyes bu rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: rtag tu 'gyur te skyes bu rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: It is always changing because a person is permanent. This is enough of a digression.

original: rdzas kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Substance and so on.

original: 'di ni dam bca'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa'o //üîΩrdzas nyid dang ldan pa de'i dngos por khas len na zhes pa /
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa'o // rdzas nyid dang ldan pa de'i dngos por khas len na zhes pa /
translated: This is a refutation from the perspective of a thesis.üîΩIf you accept that it possesses substance, it is a thing.

original: rdzas kyi dngos por khas len na'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dngos por khas len na'o //
translated: If you accept that it is a substance, it is a thing.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi dam bca' 'di yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi dam bca' 'di yin te /
translated: This is the thesis of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa ni rdzas su yod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa ni rdzas su yod do zhes pa'o //
translated: That which possesses substance is substantially existent.

original: de'i phyir skyon 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this error should be stated.

original: yon tan rnams kyang rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyang rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: It follows that qualities are also substances.

original: sbyor ba las dmigs bsal te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las dmigs bsal te /
translated: The syllogism is implied by the statement.

original: rdzas kyi sbyor ba kho na las rdzas dmigs kyis bsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sbyor ba kho na las rdzas dmigs kyis bsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The syllogism is only about substance. It is implied that substance is distinguished.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is it like? It is said:

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba gcig nyid kyi phyir dang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba gcig nyid kyi phyir dang zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of the single collection of the components.

original: pe lu ka'i gal te yang spyi rnams rang gi rten las 'phrod pa 'dus pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: pe lu ka'i gal te yang spyi rnams rang gi rten las 'phrod pa 'dus pa de lta na yang /
translated: If, on the other hand, the universals are in contact with their substrates,

original: 'phrod 'du ba gang gi rdzas nyid rdzas la 'jug pa'i 'phrod 'du de kho na yon tan rnams la yang ngo zhes pas yon tan rnams kyang rdzas su 'gyur pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'phrod 'du ba gang gi rdzas nyid rdzas la 'jug pa'i 'phrod 'du de kho na yon tan rnams la yang ngo zhes pas yon tan rnams kyang rdzas su 'gyur pa 'thob bo //
translated: then, since the contact is the contact of the substance with the substance, the universals would also become substances.

original: 'o na bee thar rnams kyi yang dag pa ldan pa bzhin du 'phrod 'du yang 'phrod 'du can so so tha dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na bee thar rnams kyi yang dag pa ldan pa bzhin du 'phrod 'du yang 'phrod 'du can so so tha dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But, just as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that contact is not a separate entity from the things that are in contact,

original: des na ci'i phyir thal 'gyur 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir thal 'gyur 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is this reductio being urged here?

original: gsungs pa / yang na spyi rnams thams cad du song ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / yang na spyi rnams thams cad du song ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúOr, because all universals pervade all things.‚Äù

original: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa'i yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa'i yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of substance‚Äù and so forth.

original: ci ste rdzas nyid dang ldan pa yang rdzas su mi 'dod na rdzas nyid dang ldan pa yod do zhes pa'i dam bca' sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste rdzas nyid dang ldan pa yang rdzas su mi 'dod na rdzas nyid dang ldan pa yod do zhes pa'i dam bca' sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not assert that that which has substance is a substance, then the thesis ‚ÄúSubstance exists‚Äù is refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is this?

original: rdzas ni rdzas ma yin pa nyid kyis sel ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas ni rdzas ma yin pa nyid kyis sel ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: because substance is excluded by being non-substance.

original: ma nges pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro zhes pa /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro zhes pa /
translated: It is a dispute about the inconclusive.

original: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rdzas nyid du sgrub par byed na yon tan rnams la yang gtan tshigs 'di yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rdzas nyid du sgrub par byed na yon tan rnams la yang gtan tshigs 'di yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one proves substance by the fact that it possesses substance, then this reason exists for the qualities as well, so it is a dispute about the inconclusive.

original: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa gzhan zhes ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa gzhan zhes ba ste /
translated: Another one who possesses substance.

original: mthun phyogs la yod cing mi mthun @161b phyogs la 'jug na ma nges par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mthun phyogs la yod cing mi mthun @161b phyogs la 'jug na ma nges par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is inconclusive when it exists in the similar class and occurs in the dissimilar class,

original: 'di la mthun phyogs la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la mthun phyogs la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: here it does not exist in the similar class,

original: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang ldan pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because another one who possesses substance is not seen.

original: 'gal ba'i rtsod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rtsod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a dispute about the contradictory?

original: de ltar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a syllogism does not exist.

original: 'dir yang rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here also substance does not exist,

original: yon tan dang rdzas rnams kyi rdzas dang rdzas ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas rnams kyi rdzas dang rdzas ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that qualities and substances would be substances and non-substances.

original: rdzas ni med de yon tan rnams kho na rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas ni med de yon tan rnams kho na rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not saying that substances do not exist because it would absurdly follow that only qualities are substances.

original: ma nges par rtsod pa 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir dogs so //
analyzed: ma nges par rtsod pa 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir dogs so //
translated: We fear that this argument is inconclusive because we see that it is mistaken.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs la ni zhes pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs la ni zhes pa /
translated: As for the reason of the definition,

original: don gzhan las log pa'i tshul gyis mtshon cha go bar byed cing rtogs bar byed do zhes pas mtshan nyid kho na gtan tshigs su 'dir mngon par dgongs te /
analyzed: don gzhan las log pa'i tshul gyis mtshon cha go bar byed cing rtogs bar byed do zhes pas mtshan nyid kho na gtan tshigs su 'dir mngon par dgongs te /
translated: it is the definition itself that is intended here as the reason, because it is said that it is the definition that makes known and causes one to understand the object by the method of exclusion from other objects.

original: sa'i sra ba nyid bzhin no //üîΩrdzas nyid dang ldan pas kyang rdzas mtshon par bya ba'o zhes pas 'di mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sa'i sra ba nyid bzhin no // rdzas nyid dang ldan pas kyang rdzas mtshon par bya ba'o zhes pas 'di mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Like the hardness of earth.üîΩAnd it is said that substances are also indicated by possessing substantiality, so this is a reason of definition.

original: de yang rdzas las gzhan la yang 'jug go zhes pa yon tan rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba brjod zin to //
analyzed: de yang rdzas las gzhan la yang 'jug go zhes pa yon tan rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba brjod zin to //
translated: And it is said that it would absurdly follow that it would also apply to things other than substances, such as qualities.

original: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a logical reason that causes understanding,

original: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis zhes pa la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis zhes pa la /
translated: With regard to the phrase ‚Äúby the generality of the property of the thesis,‚ÄùüîΩit is that which is to be proven and it is a property, thus it is the property of the thesis.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang 'di yin la chos kyang ngo zhes pa bsgrub bya'i chos so de kho na spyi ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang 'di yin la chos kyang ngo zhes pa bsgrub bya'i chos so de kho na spyi ste /
translated: That itself is the generality.

original: des mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun phyogs so //
analyzed: des mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun phyogs so //
translated: That which is similar to it is similar to the property of the thesis.

original: sar 'gyur ba ni yang 'dir spyor ba tha dad pa'i phyir sa bh'a ga dang / sa dz'a ti bzhin no //
analyzed: sar 'gyur ba ni yang 'dir spyor ba tha dad pa'i phyir sa bh'a ga dang / sa dz'a ti bzhin no //
translated: The suffix tva is added here because it is a different application, like sabhƒÅga and sajatya.

original: spyir brjod pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di thob ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di thob ce na gsungs pa /
translated: Since it is a general term, how is it obtained? It is said:

original: nye ba'i phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: nye ba'i phyir zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of proximity.‚Äù

original: gang gis na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyis khyad par du byas par chos can bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyis khyad par du byas par chos can bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The property of the thesis is qualified by such properties as impermanence.

original: de skabs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir nye pa'o //
analyzed: de skabs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir nye pa'o //
translated: Since it is the basis for that, it is proximate.

original: de'i phyir de kho na dang mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun phyogs te gzhan dang ni ma yin no zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na dang mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun phyogs te gzhan dang ni ma yin no zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the side that is in accordance with reality is the side that is in accordance with it, and not with any other. This is the reasoning.

original: 'o na 'di phyogs nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di phyogs nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Now, this is not a side,

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: because it is not accepted as the probandum.

original: don thams cad phyogs zhes par byas nas zhes pa /
analyzed: don thams cad phyogs zhes par byas nas zhes pa /
translated: Having made all objects the side,

original: rang gi yongs su bshad pa ston to phyogs su bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi yongs su bshad pa ston to phyogs su bya'o //
translated: he shows his own explanation: ‚Äúone should make it into a side.‚Äù

original: gsal bar bya'o zhes pas dngos po thams cad phyogs zhes bshad par bya'o //üîΩ'o na khyad par ni rang gi @162a * //
analyzed: gsal bar bya'o zhes pas dngos po thams cad phyogs zhes bshad par bya'o // 'o na khyad par ni rang gi @162a * //
translated: One should make it clear. Thus, all things should be explained as the side.

original: rten la nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rten la nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: Now, is not the qualifier ascertained with respect to its own basis?

original: de ci ltar gzhan gyi chos gzhan la yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci ltar gzhan gyi chos gzhan la yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How can it be the property of one thing in another?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says ‚Äúthat property which is the proof,‚Äù and so on.

original: spyi gtan tshigs nyid du nye par blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi gtan tshigs nyid du nye par blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the universal is accepted as the reason,

original: khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: and not the qualifier.

original: des na skyon 'di med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: des na skyon 'di med do zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, this fault does not exist. This is what is shown.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes ji ltar sgrub par byed par chos ni rjes su dpag pa la spyi'i ngo bor blang par bya ba de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang ste /üîΩkhyad par rjes su dpag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes ji ltar sgrub par byed par chos ni rjes su dpag pa la spyi'i ngo bor blang par bya ba de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang ste / khyad par rjes su dpag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then how is it that in an inference for others, the property of the position is taken as a general entity, but the property of the position is not suitable to be an inference of a specific attribute?

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid gcig yin pa de kho na gnyis ka la yang 'jug go zhes pas mthun phyogs kyang ni phyogs nyid 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid gcig yin pa de kho na gnyis ka la yang 'jug go zhes pas mthun phyogs kyang ni phyogs nyid 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is only impermanence that applies to both, the property of the position is also the position.

original: ci'i phyir tha snyad gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha snyad gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed ce na /
translated: Why is a convention of another convention made?

original: 'dir 'gyur mong ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur mong ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the response is ‚ÄúIt is like this . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar 'gyur mod med pa la brjod 'dod pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod med pa la brjod 'dod pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, it is not reasonable to desire to express nonexistence.

original: gsungs pa / tha dad ni yod de zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / tha dad ni yod de zhes so //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThere is existence . . .‚Äù

original: yang ci ltar tha dad med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar tha dad med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Also, how is it that impermanence is not different?

original: bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste bum pa la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid grub zin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste bum pa la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid grub zin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is like a pot, etc., because impermanence is already established in a pot, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid med la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid med la /
translated: But the probandum does not exist in the sound.

original: sgra la de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la de lta ma yin no //
translated: It is not so in the case of sound.

original: des na 'di kho na tha dad de /
analyzed: des na 'di kho na tha dad de /
translated: Therefore, this alone is different,

original: gang gcig la bsgrub bya'i chos rtogs zin cing gzhan la rtogs ma zin pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gcig la bsgrub bya'i chos rtogs zin cing gzhan la rtogs ma zin pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: where the property to be established is already known in one case and not known in another.

original: gang du de rtogs zin pa de mthun phyogs su brjod cing /
analyzed: gang du de rtogs zin pa de mthun phyogs su brjod cing /
translated: Where it is already known, that is called the similar instance.

original: gang du rtogs ma zin pa de phyogs zhes par ro //
analyzed: gang du rtogs ma zin pa de phyogs zhes par ro //
translated: Where it is not known, that is called the dissimilar instance.

original: gtan tshigs ni gnyis ka la grub pa kho na rjes su dpog pa la nye bar sbyor ro zhes pas de la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni gnyis ka la grub pa kho na rjes su dpog pa la nye bar sbyor ro zhes pas de la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is applied only to the inference when it is established for both. Therefore, there is no such classification in this case.

original: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not intended here.

original: de'i phyir 'dir tha dad pa'ang zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir tha dad pa'ang zhes te /
translated: Therefore, here also means

original: ji skad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'o //
translated: as explained.

original: yang gi sgra las tha mi dad pa yang ste rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i mi rtag pa nyid tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i yi ge gtan tshigs kyi don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra las tha mi dad pa yang ste rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i mi rtag pa nyid tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i yi ge gtan tshigs kyi don to //
translated: And from the word also, it is also non-different, because impermanence, which is the nature excluding permanence, is non-different. This is the meaning of the letter ga in the word hetu (reason).

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ste /
translated: Because of that, the different and the non-different,

original: de'i phyir mi 'dod do//
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'dod do//
translated: therefore, are not accepted.

original: phyogs dang mthun phyogs dag gcig nyid du'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun phyogs dag gcig nyid du'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the similar and the dissimilar are one.

original: 'o na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci yin zhes pa the tshom can gyi dri pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci yin zhes pa the tshom can gyi dri pa'o //
translated: Now, what is the dissimilar? This is the question of one who is doubtful.

original: the tshom gyi yang dag pa don du ma la 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: the tshom gyi yang dag pa don du ma la 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Doubt is the engagement with the real object in many ways.

original: de yang rang nyid kyis ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang rang nyid kyis ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: And that itself is taught:

original: yod do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te yang smad pa la @162b sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug mod /
analyzed: gal te yang smad pa la @162b sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug mod /
translated: Even though it engages with the contemptible, etc.,

original: de lta na yang gang kho na 'dir don gsum srid pa de kho na nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang kho na 'dir don gsum srid pa de kho na nye bar bkod pa'o //
translated: still, it is only that which is possible here in the three ways that is presented.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dir khas blang par bya'o zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khas blang par bya'o zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should accept, i.e., one should investigate.

original: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äútogether with.‚Äù

original: ma yin pa'i yi ge ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i yi ge ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
translated: The negative particle is a different case,

original: rnam par gcod pa'i sgra'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i sgra'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: which should be seen immediately after the exclusion word.

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the above passage.

original: rnam pa gsum po de rnams la /üîΩde las te mthun phyogs las gzhan dang de dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de rnams la / de las te mthun phyogs las gzhan dang de dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: With regard to those three,üîΩthe other than that, i.e., the concordant side, and that which is incompatible with it,

original: rnam pa gnyis pa 'di yang mi mthun phyogs su'i zhig khas blang par gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa 'di yang mi mthun phyogs su'i zhig khas blang par gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: these two aspects are also the discordant side.

original: re zhig gi sgras dus phyis med par yang mi mthun phyogs nyid du khas len pa bsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgras dus phyis med par yang mi mthun phyogs nyid du khas len pa bsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù eliminates the assertion that the discordant side is not nonexistent at a later time.

original: der 'gyur mod /
analyzed: der 'gyur mod /
translated: That is so.

original: de las gzhan pa la rang de dang 'gal ba la ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la rang de dang 'gal ba la ste /
translated: But the other than that is the discordant side,

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na skyon yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na skyon yin no //
translated: and both of these aspects are the discordant side here.

original: gal te de las gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du khas len na'ang kho bo la gtan tshigs med pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du khas len na'ang kho bo la gtan tshigs med pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the other than that is the discordant side, then it follows that we have no reason at all.

original: de ltar ni gang kho na bum pa la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de kho na mi rtag pa nyid las chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun phyogs las gzhan no zhes pas mi mthun phyogs yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni gang kho na bum pa la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de kho na mi rtag pa nyid las chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun phyogs las gzhan no zhes pas mi mthun phyogs yin zhing /
translated: In that case, whatever is the similar class of a pot, etc., is the dissimilar class because it is the opposite of the similar class, since it is endowed with a property that is different from impermanence.

original: de la yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And because produced, etc., are included in that, they would be indeterminate.

original: de dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid na yang /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid na yang /
translated: And in the dissimilar class, which is the opposite of that,

original: me ni 'dir dro ba nyid do zhes pa /
analyzed: me ni 'dir dro ba nyid do zhes pa /
translated: fire is hot.

original: mi mthun phyogs rnam par gcod pas gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do zhes pas 'gal ba grang pa kho na las rnam par bcad par me bsgrub par bya ba na go bar byed kyi /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs rnam par gcod pas gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do zhes pas 'gal ba grang pa kho na las rnam par bcad par me bsgrub par bya ba na go bar byed kyi /
translated: Since the proof of the probandum is understood by the elimination of the dissimilar class, it is understood that fire is established by the elimination of only the opposite of hot, which is cold.

original: dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not understood by the elimination of neither hot nor cold,

original: de ni mi 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is not the opposite.

original: de las kyang dro ba'i reg pa rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang dro ba'i reg pa rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And heat is not understood from that.

original: des na ci ltar 'di dag mi mthun phyogs su khas len par byed ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'di dag mi mthun phyogs su khas len par byed ce na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, how can these be accepted as discordant classes?üîΩThe response is:

original: gnyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The two are not discordant classes.

original: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs la'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù is a reason.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs nyid yin na /
translated: Because other and contradictory are discordant classes.

original: rim pa ji lta bar gtan tshigs med par thal 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba las kyang rnam par gcod par thal bar 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar gtan tshigs med par thal 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba las kyang rnam par gcod par thal bar 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it follows that the reason is not a discordant class, and it follows that the contradictory is not a discordant class.

original: de'i phyir 'di @163a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di @163a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: gnyis ka dag gi yang mi mthun phyogs nyid du khas blang bar byos shig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag gi yang mi mthun phyogs nyid du khas blang bar byos shig ces pa'i don to //
translated: you should accept that both are discordant classes.

original: gal te mthun phyogs las gzhan gang yin pa de mi mthun phyogs yin na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te mthun phyogs las gzhan gang yin pa de mi mthun phyogs yin na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If that which is other than the concordant class is the discordant class, etc.

original: tshig phrad ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: tshig phrad ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
translated: The particle ‚Äúna‚Äù has a different order.

original: gal te mthun phyogs la gzhan gang yin pa de mi mthun phyogs yin na khyod la gtan tshigs med pa 'thob pa ma yin pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal te mthun phyogs la gzhan gang yin pa de mi mthun phyogs yin na khyod la gtan tshigs med pa 'thob pa ma yin pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If the opposite of whatever is the concordant side is the discordant side, then it is not the case that you obtain a reason that is nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: chos gzhan dang ldan pa las mthun pa'i phyogs rang nyid kho na las gzhan nyid du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan pa las mthun pa'i phyogs rang nyid kho na las gzhan nyid du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the concordant side is different from itself due to possessing another attribute.

original: de ltar ni bram ze las gzhan shog cig ces brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni bram ze las gzhan shog cig ces brjod pa ni /
translated: In that case, when it is said, ‚ÄúBecome different from a Brahmin,‚Äù

original: bram ze kho na skyes bu nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir bram ze las gzhan yin no zhes 'jig rten na rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bram ze kho na skyes bu nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir bram ze las gzhan yin no zhes 'jig rten na rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that the world understands that a Brahmin is different from a Brahmin because he possesses other attributes, such as being a person.

original: 'o na ci zhe na brjod par 'dod pa'i chos mi brten pa rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na brjod par 'dod pa'i chos mi brten pa rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then what is it? It is the non-Brahmin, such as a k·π£atriya, who does not possess the attribute that is desired.

original: da'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: da'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is the fallacy of a reason that is nonexistent.

original: de ltar ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni gcig min sgrub par byed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni gcig min sgrub par byed pa nyid ni /
translated: In this way, the non-existence of one is established by ‚Äúin that case‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan pa mi mthun phyogs nyid yin pa la gtan tshigs ston par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan pa mi mthun phyogs nyid yin pa la gtan tshigs ston par byed cing /
translated: The other is the very discordant side, and the reason is shown.

original: de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs med par thal par 'gyur ba med pa gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs med par thal par 'gyur ba med pa gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: It is established that there is no reason of immediate succession.

original: gang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod do zhes pas mthun phyogs kho na la yod ces nges par bzung ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod do zhes pas mthun phyogs kho na la yod ces nges par bzung ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that the statement ‚ÄúIt exists in the similar instance‚Äù ascertains that it exists only in the similar instance.

original: de mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las gzhan la yang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las gzhan la yang zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist in the dissimilar instance‚Äù means that it does not exist in anything other than the similar instance.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal la sogs pa la zhes pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal la sogs pa la zhes pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
translated: Here, the suffix ‚Äúka‚Äù in ‚Äúdu·∏•khe‚Äù is the seventh case, the causal reason.

original: de la 'di ni tshogs pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni tshogs pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the compound is this:

original: gang gi phyir gang mthun phyogs kho na la yod pa'i byas ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs chos ni gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi mthun phyogs la med cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang mthun phyogs kho na la yod pa'i byas ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs chos ni gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi mthun phyogs la med cing /
translated: Because the property of the subject, such as ‚Äúbeing produced,‚Äù which exists only in the similar instance, does not exist in the dissimilar instance, which has the characteristic of being other,

original: de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: and because it is not only the reason for impermanence,

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid las gzhan yang gang chos gzhan sdug bsngal ba nyid la sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan yang yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar bzlog go //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid las gzhan yang gang chos gzhan sdug bsngal ba nyid la sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan yang yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs med par thal bar bzlog go //
translated: However, since there is another property of impermanence, and since there is also another property of the reason, namely, suffering, etc., therefore, it follows that there is no reason.

original: gal te yang mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba de mi mthun phyogs yin pa de lta na yang skyon med do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gal te yang mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba de mi mthun phyogs yin pa de lta na yang skyon med do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: If it is the case that the reason is only the opposite of the similar class, then there is no fault. This is the remainder.

original: mthun phyogs dang 'gal ba kho na zhes nges par gzung ba 'dir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthun phyogs dang 'gal ba kho na zhes nges par gzung ba 'dir blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen as the restriction that the reason is only the opposite of the similar class.

original: gal te yang zhes pa @163b 'dis 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa @163b 'dis 'di skad ston te /
translated: If it is the case that this is so, then this is what is shown.

original: 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Only the opposite is not the dissimilar class.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gzhan pa dang med pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gzhan pa dang med pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: What then? The other and nonexistence are also.

original: des na 'di skyon med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di skyon med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is faultless.

original: 'gal ba kho na mthun phyogs nyid du khas blangs nas ni bdag gis lan brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba kho na mthun phyogs nyid du khas blangs nas ni bdag gis lan brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having accepted that only the opposite is the similar class, I will give an answer.

original: ci'i phyir 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs nyid na skyon med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs nyid na skyon med ce na /
translated: Why is it that only the contradictory is the counter-correlate?

original: des na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: des na zhes pa ni 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni 'gal ba kho na mi mthun phyogs nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore means: only the contradictory is the counter-correlate.

original: gang kho na la ste mi mthun phyogs 'gal ba'i bdag nyid la med pa de kho na rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba ma rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang kho na la ste mi mthun phyogs 'gal ba'i bdag nyid la med pa de kho na rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba ma rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //

original: mthun phyogs dang 'gal ba'i mi mthun phyogs kho na la med pa'o //
analyzed: mthun phyogs dang 'gal ba'i mi mthun phyogs kho na la med pa'o //
translated: In what is the meaning of this term ‚Äúonly‚Äù?

original: kho na'i yi ge ni mthun phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par mi gcod pa'i don can no des ni de rnam par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: kho na'i yi ge ni mthun phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par mi gcod pa'i don can no des ni de rnam par gcod pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the letter ‚Äúna‚Äù is the non-exclusion of the presence of the similar class. By that, it excludes the dissimilar class.

original: 'gal ba rnam par gcod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba la rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam par gcod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba la rtogs par byed do //
translated: The exclusion of the contradictory is what causes the understanding of the probandum.

original: gal te 'gal ba kho na rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba la rtogs par byed na de las ci ltar mi 'dod pa 'ongs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba kho na rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba la rtogs par byed na de las ci ltar mi 'dod pa 'ongs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the exclusion of the contradictory is what causes the understanding of the probandum, then why is it not accepted that way?

original: gsungs pa / de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems te /
translated: The idea is as follows.

original: mi mthun phyogs las log pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun phyogs med par bsgrub bya la rtogs par byed cing dro min grang min ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs las log pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun phyogs med par bsgrub bya la rtogs par byed cing dro min grang min ni ma yin no //
translated: A reason that is the opposite of the discordant class causes the understanding of the probandum in the absence of the similar class, but not in the absence of the non-discordant class.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyang 'gal ba grang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyang 'gal ba grang ba kho na ste /
translated: The discordant class is only the contradictory cold.

original: de las kyang 'di na dro ba nyid de me'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di la /
analyzed: de las kyang 'di na dro ba nyid de me'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di la /
translated: And in this case, ‚Äúbecause of fire, there is heat here,‚Äù

original: me grang pa med pa bsgrub bya la go bar byed kyi /
analyzed: me grang pa med pa bsgrub bya la go bar byed kyi /
translated: the absence of cold fire causes the understanding of the probandum.

original: dro min grang min med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dro min grang min med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not not-warm and not-cold.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ste /
translated: This is a desire,

original: gang gi phyir dro min grang min gyi reg pa ni grang ba dang dro ba dag las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dro min grang min gyi reg pa ni grang ba dang dro ba dag las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because a contact that is not-warm and not-cold does not exist as something other than warm and cold,

original: 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya'i bye brag rnams las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya'i bye brag rnams las gzhan du'o //
translated: like the distinctions of contact such as smoothness and roughness.

original: de ltar ni bstan bcos su reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid du gsungs shing /
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan bcos su reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid du gsungs shing /
translated: In this way, eleven types of contact are mentioned in the treatise,

original: de'i nang du yang dro min grang min gyi reg bya bshad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i nang du yang dro min grang min gyi reg bya bshad pa med do //
translated: and among them, a contact that is not-warm and not-cold is not explained.

original: de'i phyir 'jam pa nyid la sogs @164a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam pa nyid la sogs @164a * //
translated: Therefore, smoothness, etc.,

original: pa rnams kho na dro min grang min no //
analyzed: pa rnams kho na dro min grang min no //
translated: are just not-warm and not-cold.

original: de rnams kyang phyogs gang na dro ba'i reg pa 'jug pa'i phyogs de na yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang phyogs gang na dro ba'i reg pa 'jug pa'i phyogs de na yod pa kho na'o //
translated: And they exist only in the place where a warm contact is active.

original: de'i phyir gang na dro ba'i reg pa yin pa de ni dro min grang min gyi reg pa rnam par gcod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na dro ba'i reg pa yin pa de ni dro min grang min gyi reg pa rnam par gcod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, where there is a warm contact, there is no exclusion of a contact that is not-warm and not-cold.

original: dro min grang min gyi reg pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa yod na chug mod /
analyzed: dro min grang min gyi reg pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa yod na chug mod /
translated: If it were different from the soft sensation that is neither hot nor cold, then it would exist.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar dro ba'i reg pa grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba de ltar dro min grang min dang yang ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar dro ba'i reg pa grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba de ltar dro min grang min dang yang ste /
translated: But even so, just as the hot sensation is incompatible with the cold sensation, so it is with the sensation that is neither hot nor cold.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not coexist.

original: ci ste mi 'gal ba de lta na yang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'gal ba de lta na yang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: But if they are not incompatible, then even so, because they coexist,

original: gang na dro ba'i reg pa yod pa de na de rnam par gcod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang na dro ba'i reg pa yod pa de na de rnam par gcod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: wherever the hot sensation exists, there is no absence of that sensation.
