original: de med par gal te mes rtogs par byed pa ma yin na ni ma yin du chug kyang yod pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin na skyon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de med par gal te mes rtogs par byed pa ma yin na ni ma yin du chug kyang yod pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin na skyon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If you say that if it is not cognized by fire, then it may not be, but if it is cognized as existent, then there is a fault.

original: med pa ni rtogs par mi byed par yang 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: med pa ni rtogs par mi byed par yang 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: But we do assert that it is not cognized as nonexistent.

original: mi 'dod pa 'bab par yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa 'bab par yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: It follows that what is not desired would be cognized.

original: reg bya la rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir reg bya'i sgra ni de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la 'jug go zhes pa'i yi ge ni gtan tshigs la'o //
analyzed: reg bya la rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir reg bya'i sgra ni de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la 'jug go zhes pa'i yi ge ni gtan tshigs la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútouch‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äútouch is understood‚Äù refers to the object that possesses touch. The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is a reason.

original: gang gi phyir me ni grang ba nyid med pa reg bya la go bar byed kyi dro min grang min med par yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me ni grang ba nyid med pa reg bya la go bar byed kyi dro min grang min med par yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Because fire is understood as touch that is not cold, not as touch that is neither warm nor cold.

original: de 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: And that is what is intended.

original: de'i phyir gang sngar 'gal ba kho na las rnam par gcod par thal par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang sngar 'gal ba kho na las rnam par gcod par thal par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the exclusion of fire from what is not cold would be absurd,

original: de ni mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i mchan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i mchan nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that would entail the absurd consequence that what is not intended would occur.

original: gal te 'o na gang na me yod pa de na 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg pa yang yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na gang na me yod pa de na 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg pa yang yod na /
translated: But if touch that is soft, etc., exists wherever fire exists,

original: ci'i phyir mes dro ba'i reg pa kho na rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mes dro ba'i reg pa kho na rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: why is only the touch of warmth understood as fire and not the others?

original: gang zhig la gang gis khyab pa des de rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig la gang gis khyab pa des de rtogs par byed de /
translated: Whatever is pervaded by something is understood through that.

original: gal te yang dro ba'i reg pas sam gzhan gyis kyang me la khyab na /
analyzed: gal te yang dro ba'i reg pas sam gzhan gyis kyang me la khyab na /
translated: If heat or something else pervades fire,

original: de yang rtogs par byed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang rtogs par byed pa kho na ste /
translated: then it is only that which causes the understanding of fire.

original: gtan tshigs ni don du ma grub par byed pa nyid mi 'gal ba kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni don du ma grub par byed pa nyid mi 'gal ba kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not established as the mere cause of the non-contradiction of the meaning.

original: ci ste ma grub na de la 'phul ba nyid kyi phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes pas rtsod pa 'di med do //
analyzed: ci ste ma grub na de la 'phul ba nyid kyi phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes pas rtsod pa 'di med do //
translated: If it is not established, then because it is the very thing that is being inferred, it is not the cause of understanding. Thus this dispute does not exist.

original: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun phyogs dag 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun phyogs dag 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: Let it be that the other and the contradictory are the discordant classes.

original: med pa ni ci ltar yin /
analyzed: med pa ni ci ltar yin /
translated: But how is it that the non-existent is the discordant class?

original: med pa mi mthun phyogs nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: med pa mi mthun phyogs nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the non-existent is the very discordant class,

original: gang 'di skad brjod pa /
analyzed: gang 'di skad brjod pa /
translated: then this statement

original: so sor mi mthun phyogs la yang //
analyzed: so sor mi mthun phyogs la yang //
translated: that the individual discordant classes

original: yod med rnam pa gnyis phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med rnam pa gnyis phyir ro //
translated: are of two types, existent and non-existent,

original: zhes pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes pa mi rigs te /
translated: is unreasonable.

original: dngos @164b por ma gyur pa'i phyogs chos ni med pa la yod pa nyid du 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: dngos @164b por ma gyur pa'i phyogs chos ni med pa la yod pa nyid du 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: It may be that the property of the discordant class, which is not an entity, becomes existent in the non-existent.

original: dngos por gyur pa ni ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa ni ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is it that the existent becomes so?

original: gsungs pa / de phyir mthun phyogs med kho na'o zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / de phyir mthun phyogs med kho na'o zhes so //
translated: It is said: Therefore the concordant class is only non-existent.

original: kho na'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi sgra'i de ma thag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho na'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi sgra'i de ma thag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù should be seen as immediately following the word ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes pa 'dis kyang de ma thag tu bsgrub pa'i gzhan pa dang / 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs su 'gyur ba la snyegs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa 'dis kyang de ma thag tu bsgrub pa'i gzhan pa dang / 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs su 'gyur ba la snyegs so //
translated: And this ‚Äútherefore‚Äù also refers to the fact that the other and the contradictory are the discordant classes.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs yin pa de kho na'i phyir mthun phyogs med pa ni mi mthun phyogs su 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag mi mthun phyogs yin pa de kho na'i phyir mthun phyogs med pa ni mi mthun phyogs su 'dod do //
translated: Since the other and the contradictory are discordant classes, the absence of the property of the subject in the discordant class is accepted as the third form of the reason, the forward pervasion.

original: de las kyang med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi mthun phyogs la ltos pas phyogs chos yod dang med phyir ro zhes pa 'di mi rigs so zhes pa 'di dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi mthun phyogs la ltos pas phyogs chos yod dang med phyir ro zhes pa 'di mi rigs so zhes pa 'di dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: And in that case, it is not reasonable to suspect that the property of the subject is present or absent in the discordant class, which is characterized by nonexistence, because it is dependent on that.

original: gang gi phyir med pa tsam ni mi mthun phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa tsam ni mi mthun phyogs ma yin no //
translated: Because mere nonexistence is not a discordant class.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: It is the other and the contradictory.

original: yang ci ltar gsum po rnams la mi mthun phyogs nyid du 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar gsum po rnams la mi mthun phyogs nyid du 'thob ce na /
translated: And how do the three obtain the status of discordant classes?

original: gang gi phyir mthun phyogs ma yin pa ni mi mthun phyogs so zhes mthun phyogs ldog pa ni mi mthun phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthun phyogs ma yin pa ni mi mthun phyogs so zhes mthun phyogs ldog pa ni mi mthun phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin zhing /
translated: Because the opposite of the concordant side is the discordant side. The opposite of the concordant side is the definition of the discordant side.

original: ma yin par dgag pa de ni mi mthun phyogs de dag la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa de ni mi mthun phyogs de dag la yang mtshungs te /
translated: And that internal negation is the same in those discordant sides.

original: ldog pa rtogs pa ni thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: ldog pa rtogs pa ni thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because the realization of the opposite is the same in all.

original: dngos dang don gyis go bas kyang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos dang don gyis go bas kyang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: And it is also understood by the explicit and implicit.

original: de ltar gcig kyang zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar gcig kyang zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúeven though it is one‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs don du ma sgrub par byed pa nyid du ston cing med pa mi mthun phyogs nyid du brtan par byed do //
analyzed: med pa mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs don du ma sgrub par byed pa nyid du ston cing med pa mi mthun phyogs nyid du brtan par byed do //
translated: It shows that the non-existence is the proof of the discordant side and establishes the non-existence as the discordant side.

original: mtshan nyid las zhes pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid las zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las zhes pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid las zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the definition‚Äù means from the definition of the reason.

original: gzhan pa dang med pa'i mi mthun phyogs dag la /
analyzed: gzhan pa dang med pa'i mi mthun phyogs dag la /
translated: In the other and the non-existent discordant sides,

original: du ma sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'gal pa'i mi mthun phyogs la yang de rtogs pa'o zhes pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: du ma sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'gal pa'i mi mthun phyogs la yang de rtogs pa'o zhes pas ma bshad do //
translated: In order to demonstrate the establishment of the many, he does not explain that it is understood in the case of the contradictory discordant side.

original: 'o na yang 'di zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'o na yang 'di zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: But then, this and so forth.

original: gang rnams byas pa nyid thun mong ba ni /
analyzed: gang rnams byas pa nyid thun mong ba ni /
translated: That which is the commonness of the produced

original: de la the tshom gyi rgyu yin te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: de la the tshom gyi rgyu yin te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: is the cause of doubt, like a pot and so forth.

original: de yang ni mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi thun mong pa yang ngo zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan smras so //
analyzed: de yang ni mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi thun mong pa yang ngo zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan smras so //
translated: And that is also the commonness of impermanence, selflessness, and so forth. Thus he states the natural reflection.

original: spyi zhes pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: spyi zhes pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi chos so //
translated: The property of the subject is stated with universality and so forth.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni dpe'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is in pots and so forth.

original: the tshom nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: the tshom nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the valid cognition is stated with doubt will arise.

original: @165a * // min zhes pa la sogs pas ma nges par gsungs so //
analyzed: @165a * // min zhes pa la sogs pas ma nges par gsungs so //
translated: With not so, and so forth, he states the uncertainty.

original: rtogs par byar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir the tshom gyi rgyu ni blun po zhes par gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs par byar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir the tshom gyi rgyu ni blun po zhes par gsungs so //
translated: Because it is not possible to understand, the cause of doubt is stated with the fool.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni khyab pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is the following.

original: spyi yin no zhes pa kho nas the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi yin no zhes pa kho nas the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The mere fact that it is a universal is not a cause of doubt.

original: de ltar ni du ba ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa don du ma dang lhan cig 'byung pa the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni du ba ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa don du ma dang lhan cig 'byung pa the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, smoke is not a cause of doubt with regard to the many meanings such as substance, etc., which occur together.üîΩIf it occurs in many things in the absence of its probandum, then it becomes a cause of doubt.

original: gal te rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med par du ma la 'jug na the tshom gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med par du ma la 'jug na the tshom gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: To show this, he says,

original: bum pa la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn a pot, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: byas pa ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa la'ang mthong ste /
analyzed: byas pa ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa la'ang mthong ste /
translated: That which is produced is seen in pots, etc., even in the absence of each other.

original: de'i phyir de ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du rigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du rigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is a cause of doubt.

original: de bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa la mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes pas ni /
analyzed: de bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa la mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes pas ni /
translated: But that which is without self, etc., is not seen in the absence of each other.üîΩTherefore, it is not a cause of doubt.

original: spyi yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not an indicator because it is a universal.

original: khyab pa yod pa na'o //
analyzed: khyab pa yod pa na'o //
translated: It is when there is pervasion.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes pa ni nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes pa ni nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúdetermining‚Äù means ‚Äúdeterminative.‚Äù

original: dang gi sgra phyis pa las zhes pa /
analyzed: dang gi sgra phyis pa las zhes pa /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is elided.

original: dang gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúand‚Äù is understood.

original: gang du gang sbyar ba med kyang don rtogs pa der de phyis pa'o zhes brjod par bya zhing 'dir yang /
analyzed: gang du gang sbyar ba med kyang don rtogs pa der de phyis pa'o zhes brjod par bya zhing 'dir yang /
translated: Where the meaning is understood even without the application of ‚Äúand,‚Äù there it is elided. And here too,

original: yang rnam gsum zhes brjod pa las dang / sngar yang rnam pa gsum nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir don rtogs so //
analyzed: yang rnam gsum zhes brjod pa las dang / sngar yang rnam pa gsum nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir don rtogs so //
translated: the meaning is understood from the expression ‚Äúthree kinds‚Äù and from the establishment of the threefold nature earlier.

original: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Otherwise, etc.

original: gal te yang ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas dang gi don rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas dang gi don rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúand‚Äù is not understood in the way stated,

original: de las gnyis po 'di kho na'i lhur len pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gnyis po 'di kho na'i lhur len pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the meaning of ‚Äúonly‚Äù is understood as the emphasis on just these two.

original: de lta na gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: de lta na gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: In that case, when, etc.

original: mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid smras so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid smras so //
translated: states the nonpervasion of the definition.

original: dngos po yod na de la med do zhes smra ba nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod na de la med do zhes smra ba nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: If an entity exists, one can say that it is nonexistent, but not otherwise.

original: gang gi phyir rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par can du 'dir med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par can du 'dir med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because here nonexistence is expressed as having the distinction of a particular basis.

original: mthun phyogs med pa yang mi mthun phyogs su brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mthun phyogs med pa yang mi mthun phyogs su brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the absence of a similar instance also expressed as a dissimilar instance?

original: de ni ci ltar med do zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni ci ltar med do zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: How can it be said to be nonexistent?

original: dngos por gyur pa med do zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa med do zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it is nonexistent as an entity.

original: de'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: At that time, etc.

original: 'dir rten rnam par bcad pa'i dbang ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir rten rnam par bcad pa'i dbang ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the power is not the elimination of a basis.

original: 'o na ci zhe na bsgrub par bya ba med pa brjod pas /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na bsgrub par bya ba med pa brjod pas /
translated: Well then, since the absence of the probandum is expressed,

original: bsgrub par bya ba yod par gyur pa la rtags yod par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yod par gyur pa la rtags yod par brjod pa'o //
translated: the evidence is expressed as the existence of the probandum.

original: gal te yang dngos po rtag pa med pa kho na yin na de la yod @165b par ches shin tu 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rtag pa med pa kho na yin na de la yod @165b par ches shin tu 'grub ste /
translated: If a permanent entity is absolutely nonexistent, then it is established as utterly nonexistent.

original: dngos po rtag pa yod na byas pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i chos ni de la yang 'jug par dogs shing /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa yod na byas pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i chos ni de la yang 'jug par dogs shing /
translated: If a permanent thing existed, then the qualities of a thing, such as being produced, would also apply to it.

original: de las kyang de yod par brjod pa'i ched du 'bad pa gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang de yod par brjod pa'i ched du 'bad pa gnas par bya'o //
translated: And for that reason, one would have to make an effort to maintain that it exists.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po rtag pa med pa kho na'o zhes khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po rtag pa med pa kho na'o zhes khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when one accepts that a permanent thing does not exist at all,

original: bsgrub par bya pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa the tshom med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa the tshom med pa kho na'o //
translated: then there is no doubt that the proof of the probandum exists.

original: gtan tshigs kho na 'ba' zhig pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kho na 'ba' zhig pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Only the reason alone should be stated.

original: gang gi don du dpe brjod par bya ba'i don de grub zin byas nas so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du dpe brjod par bya ba'i don de grub zin byas nas so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the example should not be stated, because the meaning for which the example is stated has already been established. This is the intended meaning.

original: rgyu ci'i phyir de ltar phyogs chos rnam pa dgur phye zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir de ltar phyogs chos rnam pa dgur phye zhe na /
translated: Why is the property of the subject divided into nine types in that way?

original: gang la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa can dang / gang la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po'i sgo can de dag kho na rang gi khyab byed bsgrub par bya ba la go bar byed pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gang la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa can dang / gang la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po'i sgo can de dag kho na rang gi khyab byed bsgrub par bya ba la go bar byed pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: The reason is the property of the subject and the pervasion is correct.

original: bzlog pa na yang zlog par byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: bzlog pa na yang zlog par byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: The opposite of the reason is the opposite of the probandum.

original: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs gnyis dag nges par bstan cing /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs gnyis dag nges par bstan cing /
translated: To demonstrate this meaning, the two reasons ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of arising in dependence on effort‚Äù are definitely stated in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: sgra rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'gal ba gnyis dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sgra rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'gal ba gnyis dag kyang ngo //
translated: The two contradictions ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of arising in dependence on effort‚Äù are stated in the proof of sound as permanent.

original: kha cig khyad par dang spyi'i ma des pa dag kyang mtha' gcig pa can nyid du smra'o //
analyzed: kha cig khyad par dang spyi'i ma des pa dag kyang mtha' gcig pa can nyid du smra'o //
translated: Some say that the nonobservation of a pervader and the nonobservation of a nature are also one-sided.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa can dang rjes su 'gro ba can ni go phyed kyi gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes sgrub pa'i ched du gzhan gnyis dag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa can dang rjes su 'gro ba can ni go phyed kyi gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes sgrub pa'i ched du gzhan gnyis dag ste /
translated: Therefore, the two others are stated in order to prove that a reason which is half-way between the similar and the dissimilar instances is not a correct reason.

original: dper na sgra rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan bya nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan bya nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is permanent, because it is audible, and because it is a product, like a pot.‚Äù

original: gtan tshogs kyi ldog pa gtso bor bshad pa'i ched du gsum ste /
analyzed: gtan tshogs kyi ldog pa gtso bor bshad pa'i ched du gsum ste /
translated: Three are stated in order to explain primarily the reversal of the reason.

original: de ltar ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go byed ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go byed ma yin te /
translated: For, in this way, a reason is not understood by way of forward pervasion,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtsol ma thag tu byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes pas ma go ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtsol ma thag tu byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes pas ma go ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because ‚ÄúIt is impermanent, because it is produced,‚Äù is not understood.

original: de las mi 'gyur te ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las mi 'gyur te ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It does not follow from that, because it is only forward pervasion that is without reversal.

original: 'o na reg bya ma yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes pa 'di la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na reg bya ma yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes pa 'di la 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, then, ‚ÄúIt is permanent, because it is not tangible,‚Äù would be a correct reason.

original: 'di la yang rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, too, the pervasion is not principal, so it is not.

original: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing ldog pa stobs chung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing ldog pa stobs chung ba ste /
translated: Here, the pervasion is powerful and the counter-pervasion is weak.

original: gtan tshigs mthun phyogs la khyab pa'i phyir dang mi mthun phyogs 'ga' zhig la med pa'i phyir te /üîΩdper na rtsol ma thag tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mthun phyogs la khyab pa'i phyir dang mi mthun phyogs 'ga' zhig la med pa'i phyir te / dper na rtsol ma thag tu byung ba ste /
translated: Because the reason pervades the similar class and because it does not exist in some of the dissimilar class.üîΩFor example, it is like saying,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa go byed du @166a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa go byed du @166a * //
translated: Because it is produced immediately upon effort,üîΩit is impermanent.

original: 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod pa tsam gyis ma yin zhing ldog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma yin la gtso che bas kyang gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad las ldog pa nges pas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod pa tsam gyis ma yin zhing ldog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma yin la gtso che bas kyang gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad las ldog pa nges pas yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not understood by the mere existence of the pervasion, nor by the counter-pervasion, nor by the principal, but rather by the ascertainment of the counter-pervasion of everything.

original: de las kyang gang byas pa de mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes rtag pa rnam par gcod pas go par byed do //
analyzed: de las kyang gang byas pa de mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes rtag pa rnam par gcod pas go par byed do //
translated: And from that, it is understood by the exclusion of permanence, that whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: 'o na sgra mi rtag ste rtsol ma thag byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i dper brjod 'di kho na bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul bstan pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na sgra mi rtag ste rtsol ma thag byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i dper brjod 'di kho na bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul bstan pa kho na ste /
translated: Well, this example, Sound is impermanent because it arises from effort, merely teaches the illustration of the definition of a reason.üîΩ

original: rtsol ma thag pa'i bsal ba 'byung ba dang skye ba dag la rtsol ma thag tu 'byung ba'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol ma thag pa'i bsal ba 'byung ba dang skye ba dag la rtsol ma thag tu 'byung ba'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, the example, Sound is impermanent because it arises from effort, alone demonstrates the definition of a reason, because it demonstrates the subject alone, since arising from effort is expressed by the word arising in the case of the manifest and arising.

original: de la gang gi tshe bsal ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par bya ba de'i tshe rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni 'bras bur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe bsal ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par bya ba de'i tshe rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni 'bras bur 'gyur zhing /
translated: When it is expressed as the characteristic of the manifest, then arising from effort becomes the property to be proven.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rang bzhin no //
translated: When it is expressed as the characteristic of arising, then it is the essence.

original: nges na ci'i don du rang bzhin byas pa nyid tha dad du dper brjod ce na /
analyzed: nges na ci'i don du rang bzhin byas pa nyid tha dad du dper brjod ce na /
translated: If it is certain, for what purpose is the example of essence and product stated separately?

original: rang bzhin thams cad rnam pa 'di lta bur mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa kho na'o zhes kha cig dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin thams cad rnam pa 'di lta bur mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa kho na'o zhes kha cig dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Some might suspect that all essences are only present in one part of the similar class in this way.

original: de'i phyir de bsal ba'i ched du tha dad par dper brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bsal ba'i ched du tha dad par dper brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that, it is given as a separate example.

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshig bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rang don rjes su dpag par bshad zin pa'i don can yin yang slar yang 'dir skabs su bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshig bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rang don rjes su dpag par bshad zin pa'i don can yin yang slar yang 'dir skabs su bya ste /
translated: In order to understand the words of the reason specifically, although the meaning of the inference for one's own sake has already been explained, it is presented again here.

original: des na rab tu dbye ba tsam bshad de /
analyzed: des na rab tu dbye ba tsam bshad de /
translated: Therefore, only the classification is explained.

original: mtshan nyid ni de kho na'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de kho na'o //
translated: The definition is exactly that.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas nges par gzung ba ngas nye bar thob par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas nges par gzung ba ngas nye bar thob par byed de /
translated: Moreover, etc. indicates that I will obtain it.

original: 'di yang ci zhig yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di yang ci zhig yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is this? It is said:

original: bsgrub bya la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed ces pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'dus pa nyid la ltos pas na ma ning gis bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed ces pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'dus pa nyid la ltos pas na ma ning gis bstan to //
translated: The reason that contradicts the probandum is taught by the neuter gender, since it depends on the very collection that will be explained.

original: 'gal ba thams cad kyang bsgrub bya la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba thams cad kyang bsgrub bya la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed yin te /
translated: All contradictions are reasons that contradict the probandum.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya la gnod pa'i sgrub byed ces pa'i tshig gi shugs las khyad par rtogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya la gnod pa'i sgrub byed ces pa'i tshig gi shugs las khyad par rtogs par bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúobjection‚Äù should be understood as implying a qualification.

original: de yang gang ngag tu ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa la gnod ba sgrub par byed pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gang ngag tu ma brjod kyang 'dod pas khyab pa la gnod ba sgrub par byed pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood as the refutation of what is intended, even though it is not actually stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni gnod pa la gnod par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni gnod pa la gnod par byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And for that very reason, it should be called ‚Äúthe refutation of the refutation.‚Äù

original: de dper brjod kyis ston te /üîΩdper na zhes pa la sogs pas so //üîΩtha dad pa rnams kyi zhes pa mig la sogs ba rnams @166b kyi'o //
analyzed: de dper brjod kyis ston te / dper na zhes pa la sogs pas so // tha dad pa rnams kyi zhes pa mig la sogs ba rnams @166b kyi'o //
translated: He illustrates that:üîΩFor example, when one says, ‚ÄúThe eye and so on are not the self because of being different from it.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye and so on are not the self because of being different from it.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa nyid ni gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus pa nyid ni gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed do //
translated: The mere collection is also established as the object of the refutation.

original: 'dus ba nyid kyang chos sam chos can gyi khyad par la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus ba nyid kyang chos sam chos can gyi khyad par la gnod par byed do //
translated: The mere collection is also the refutation of the qualification of the subject or predicate.

original: gang kho na 'dis bsgrub par 'dod pa de kho na la ltos nas chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du bshad de /
analyzed: gang kho na 'dis bsgrub par 'dod pa de kho na la ltos nas chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du bshad de /
translated: In dependence on just that which he wishes to establish, he explains the qualification of the subject or predicate.

original: g-yon can gyi tha snyad la khyad par ji lta ba bzhin skyon bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: g-yon can gyi tha snyad la khyad par ji lta ba bzhin skyon bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: In order to show the fault of the convention of the deceitful just as it is.

original: 'di rnams ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don yin te zhes brjod pa na chos kyi khyad par nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don yin te zhes brjod pa na chos kyi khyad par nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par yin zhing /
translated: When it is said that these are the objects of the non-composite consciousnesses of others, because the distinction of the property is taken up, it is a distinction of that.

original: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don rnams gzhan gyi don yin no zhes pa chos can gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don rnams gzhan gyi don yin no zhes pa chos can gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The distinction of the subject is that the non-composite objects of the eye, etc. are the objects of others.

original: gtan tshigs kho na'i nang du 'dus //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kho na'i nang du 'dus //
translated: It is included in the reason alone.

original: zhes pa / ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dod ba'am mi 'dod ba sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: zhes pa / ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dod ba'am mi 'dod ba sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs te /
translated: That which establishes the desired or undesired intrinsic nature of a thing as it abides is a reason.

original: 'dir ni 'gal ba gzhan yang yod do zhes pa'i tshig las /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'gal ba gzhan yang yod do zhes pa'i tshig las /
translated: Here, there is also another contradiction.

original: sbyor ba po'i 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa don gcig min sgrub par byed pa de'i nang du 'du bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba po'i 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa don gcig min sgrub par byed pa de'i nang du 'du bar rig par bya'o //
translated: From the words, ‚ÄúThere is also another,‚Äù it should be understood that the reason is included in the establishment of the opposite of the desire of the one who formulates the syllogism, which is not the same as the establishment of the reason.

original: ji ltar sgra rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhas pa don gcig min sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs kho na yin pa de ltar 'di yang ngo zhes pa'o zhes pa'i yi ge ni gtan tshigs la ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhas pa don gcig min sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs kho na yin pa de ltar 'di yang ngo zhes pa'o zhes pa'i yi ge ni gtan tshigs la ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to the reason.

original: gang gi phyir don gcig min sgrub par byed pa'i 'gal pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir dgu po rnams las phyi rol du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gcig min sgrub par byed pa'i 'gal pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir dgu po rnams las phyi rol du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is included in the contradictory reason that proves the opposite of the thesis, it is not posited as a separate one among the nine.

original: de'i phyir nges par gzung ba 'gal ba med do zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par gzung ba 'gal ba med do zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that there is no contradiction in the ascertainment.

original: 'o na 'dus pa rnams gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa nges pa med pa'i phyir 'di 'gal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'dus pa rnams gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa nges pa med pa'i phyir 'di 'gal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Well, since the collection of causes definitely benefits others, this is not contradictory.

original: gang 'dus pa rnams gzhan la phan pa byed pa'o zhes pa'i nges pa 'di ci yod de /
analyzed: gang 'dus pa rnams gzhan la phan pa byed pa'o zhes pa'i nges pa 'di ci yod de /
translated: What is the certainty here that the collection of causes definitely benefits others?

original: 'di yang rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas she na /
analyzed: 'di yang rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas she na /
translated: This is also because causes do not necessarily possess effects.

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not arise.

original: 'dir phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba la thogs pa med pa'i nus pa can gyi mig la sogs pa rnams phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba la thogs pa med pa'i nus pa can gyi mig la sogs pa rnams phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the eyes and so on, which have the capacity to assist in the action without obstruction, are taken as the subject.

original: de ltar na yang 'dus pa la phan 'dogs pa zhes pa'i 'brel ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'dus pa la phan 'dogs pa zhes pa'i 'brel ba ci zhe na /
translated: Even so, what is the relation between the assistance and the collection?

original: 'di yang skyon ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di yang skyon ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: This also is not a fault.üîΩBecause the eyes and so on, which have this kind of nature, assist others.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par 'di lta bu'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na'i phan pa rnams gzhan la byed de /üîΩde ltar gyur ba'i phan pa @167a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par 'di lta bu'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na'i phan pa rnams gzhan la byed de / de ltar gyur ba'i phan pa @167a * //
translated: The assistance that they provide is just that.

original: byed pa de rnams kho na 'dus pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: byed pa de rnams kho na 'dus pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: Those that provide assistance are called a collection,

original: du ma'i bdag nyid can nyid chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i bdag nyid can nyid chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they have the property of being a multiplicity.

original: de grub na yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas gzhag pa'i gcig gi rang bzhin nyid nyams par byed do zhes pas 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de grub na yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas gzhag pa'i gcig gi rang bzhin nyid nyams par byed do zhes pas 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is established, then the assertion that the nature of a single thing is posited by the desire of a person is undermined. Thus there is a contradiction.

original: 'dir gcig gi tshig gi mtha' can gyi rigs kyi sgra rnams la kha cig tu rigs tsam brjod par 'dod kyi grangs ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gcig gi tshig gi mtha' can gyi rigs kyi sgra rnams la kha cig tu rigs tsam brjod par 'dod kyi grangs ma yin te /
translated: Here, in some cases, the word ‚Äúkind‚Äù with the suffix of the singular is intended to express just the kind, not the number.

original: dper na bram ze gzhom bya ma yin zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze gzhom bya ma yin zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBrahmins are not to be killed.‚Äù

original: kha cig tu gcig nyid kyi grangs te dper na 'dir ba lang 'ga' zhig mthong ngo zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu gcig nyid kyi grangs te dper na 'dir ba lang 'ga' zhig mthong ngo zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: In some cases, it is the number one. For example, ‚ÄúI see some cows here.‚Äù

original: ba lang gi sgra ni gsal ba'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra ni gsal ba'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is for the purpose of illustrating a particular instance.

original: kha cig tu gnyis ka ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu gnyis ka ste /
translated: In some cases, both [the kind and the number].

original: dper na phyugs kyis mchod sbyin byed do zhes pa 'di lta bur ro //
analyzed: dper na phyugs kyis mchod sbyin byed do zhes pa 'di lta bur ro //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThey perform sacrifice with cattle.‚Äù

original: 'dir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la rtogs pa ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la rtogs pa ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Here, what is the understanding of the definitions of reason, etc.? It is said:

original: 'dir yang zhes pa brjod ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes pa brjod ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the just-mentioned verse.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la zhes pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the definitions of reason, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba dang ma nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba dang ma nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes contradiction and uncertainty.

original: 'di la grangs gcig yin pa zhes pa ni grangs gcig can te de'i dngos po ni grangs gcig can nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la grangs gcig yin pa zhes pa ni grangs gcig can te de'i dngos po ni grangs gcig can nyid do //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is the number one. Its thing is the number one itself.

original: brjod par 'dod pa yang de yin la grangs gcig pa can yang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa yang de yin la grangs gcig pa can yang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: And that is what is intended to be expressed, and it is also the number one. The words are to be combined in this way.

original: de yang ci zhig la zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig la zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: And what is that? It is said:

original: rigs kyi tshig gi don la zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi tshig gi don la zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúin the meaning of the word type.‚Äù

original: 'dir kha cig rigs tshig gi don du 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig rigs tshig gi don du 'dod cing /
translated: Here, some assert the meaning of the word type.

original: gzhan rnams ni rdzas te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni rdzas te /
translated: Others assert it as a substance.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gyi don du de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gyi don du de skad brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the meaning of a qualifier.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: rten gyi grangs kyis 'dir rigs nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi grangs kyis 'dir rigs nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the type is taught by the number of the basis.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gcig la sogs pa'i gzhi kho na 'dir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rigs su rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gcig la sogs pa'i gzhi kho na 'dir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rigs su rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the basis of the reason, etc., should be known as the type of the reason, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: re zhig rigs brjod par 'dod pa ni rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: re zhig rigs brjod par 'dod pa ni rigs pa yin na /
translated: It is reasonable that the type is what is intended to be expressed.

original: dper brjod mtshan nyid gcig sbyar bar ni 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper brjod mtshan nyid gcig sbyar bar ni 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not appropriate to apply the same characteristic to an example,

original: de nyid rang gi ngo bos rjod par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi ngo bos rjod par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow that it would be expressed by its own nature,

original: 'dzin to zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzin to zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the words ‚Äúit apprehends‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ste gcig nyid kyi grangs brjod par 'dod pa'i dgos pa ci yin zhes mi shes pa 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste gcig nyid kyi grangs brjod par 'dod pa'i dgos pa ci yin zhes mi shes pa 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the purpose of expressing the number one?‚Äù it is like asking a question to one who does not know.

original: 'gal ba dag las zhes pa la sogs pa la phan tshun @167b 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag las zhes pa la sogs pa la phan tshun @167b 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba dag ste /
translated: With respect to ‚Äúfrom contradictory reasons,‚Äù they are contradictory because they establish mutually contradictory objects.

original: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin /
translated: Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot.

original: sgra rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir sgra nyid bzhin zhes pa 'di dag gnyi ga yang rang gi yul la nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs dag yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir sgra nyid bzhin zhes pa 'di dag gnyi ga yang rang gi yul la nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs dag yin zhing /
translated: Sound is permanent because it is audible, like sound itself. These two are reasons that ascertain their objects.

original: tshogs pa dag ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshogs pa dag ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: When they are combined, they are seen to be the cause of doubt.

original: de bzhin du sgra rtag ste byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rtag ste byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, sound is permanent because it is produced.

original: mi rtag ste mnyan bya nyid kyi phyir zhes bsnol ba dag la ni 'gal ba dag kyang mnyam pa dag la the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag ste mnyan bya nyid kyi phyir zhes bsnol ba dag la ni 'gal ba dag kyang mnyam pa dag la the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
translated: In the case of the two contradictory reasons, ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúaudible,‚Äù they are equal in being causes of doubt.

original: 'di ni snga ma kho nas rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dper ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma kho nas rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dper ma brjod do //
translated: This is not given as an example because it is understood from the previous explanation.

original: de bzhin the tshom rtags dag las //
analyzed: de bzhin the tshom rtags dag las //
translated: Doubt from contradictory reasons

original: zhes pa gang gi tshe sgra ni rdzas ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi tshe sgra ni rdzas ma yin zhing /
translated: When sound is not a substance

original: las ma yin te mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na ro bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe yid kyis dang de rtogs pa'i las kyis kyang ma nges pa'i phyir the tshom mo //
analyzed: las ma yin te mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na ro bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe yid kyis dang de rtogs pa'i las kyis kyang ma nges pa'i phyir the tshom mo //
translated: and is not an action because it is not apprehended by the eye, like taste, then there is doubt because it is not ascertained by the mental faculty or the action of understanding that.

original: gang gi tshe yang mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes byas pa de'i tshe yang bum pa la sogs pas dang des rtogs pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes byas pa de'i tshe yang bum pa la sogs pas dang des rtogs pa'i las kyis so //
translated: When it is said that it is perceptible, then there is doubt because it is not ascertained by a pot or the action of understanding that.

original: gang gi tshe sgra ni rdzas ma yin zhing las ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra ni rdzas ma yin zhing las ma yin te /
translated: When sound is not a substance and is not an actionüîΩbecause it is not apprehended by the eye, like taste, then there is doubt because it is not ascertained by the mental faculty or the action of understanding that.

original: mig gis gzung bya ma yin zhing mngon sum pa nyid kyi phyir ro bzhin zhes lhan cig pa dag sbyor ba de'i tshe nges pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bya ma yin zhing mngon sum pa nyid kyi phyir ro bzhin zhes lhan cig pa dag sbyor ba de'i tshe nges pa mthong ngo //
translated: If it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.

original: 'o na med na mi 'byung ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid de /üîΩde yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag kho na la yin no //
analyzed: 'o na med na mi 'byung ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid de / de yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag kho na la yin no //
translated: If it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin nyid kyang dngos po rnams la gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin nyid kyang dngos po rnams la gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: If it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.

original: de don gzhan la nye bar gnas pas nyams pa'am skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de don gzhan la nye bar gnas pas nyams pa'am skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi gtan tshigs yin pa ni don gzhan dang lhan cig pa yang de de'i gtan tshigs kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi gtan tshigs yin pa ni don gzhan dang lhan cig pa yang de de'i gtan tshigs kho na ste /
translated: If it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.

original: gang yang gang la the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa ni lhan cig pa yin yang de de la the tshom gyi rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: gang yang gang la the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa ni lhan cig pa yin yang de de la the tshom gyi rgyu kho na'o //
translated: If it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.

original: de'i phyir zhe na gcig nyid kyi grangs brjod par 'dod ce na 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe na gcig nyid kyi grangs brjod par 'dod ce na 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: If it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason, then it is not non-apprehension.üîΩIf it is non-apprehension, then it is not a reason.üîΩIf it is a reason

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags kho na la 'di de ltar yin zhing de'i dbang du byas nas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid bshad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags kho na la 'di de ltar yin zhing de'i dbang du byas nas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid bshad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This is the case only with a reason based on the force of things, and it is not the case with the one based on scripture, with reference to which it is said that the number of theses is one.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the case with the one based on scripture?

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis ma zhugs pa lung la brten pa'i ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis ma zhugs pa lung la brten pa'i ste /
translated: It is based on scripture, not on the force of things.

original: de la yang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa srid de /
analyzed: de la yang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa srid de /
translated: And in that case, the thesis is of the type just explained.

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams don rnams la 'khrul pas phyin ci log gi rang bzhin nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te de @168a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams don rnams la 'khrul pas phyin ci log gi rang bzhin nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro // gal te de @168a * //
translated: This is because the authors of treatises err with regard to the meaning and so compose a treatise that is of a deceptive nature.

original: lta na 'dir byas ba nyid de mnyan bya dag las sgra la rtag pa nyid dang mi rtag par the tshom mthong ngo zhes bshad pa de ci ltar yin /
analyzed: lta na 'dir byas ba nyid de mnyan bya dag las sgra la rtag pa nyid dang mi rtag par the tshom mthong ngo zhes bshad pa de ci ltar yin /
translated: If that is so, how is it that the author of the Pramanavarttika says, ‚ÄúHere, one sees doubt with regard to sound, whether it is permanent or impermanent, from the words of the Vedas‚Äù?

original: ji tsam du byas pa nyid ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: ji tsam du byas pa nyid ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin te /
translated: To the extent that ‚Äúbeing a product‚Äù is based on the force of things,

original: de'i phyir de 'dir nye bar dgod par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dir nye bar dgod par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is not appropriate to cite it here.

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: phyogs tsam bstan pa'i ched du dper brjod pa 'di slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs tsam bstan pa'i ched du dper brjod pa 'di slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: The master has stated this example in order to teach a part of this.

original: 'di ni 'dir dpe brjod du rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir dpe brjod du rigs te /
translated: This is suitable to be stated as an example here.

original: gang yul thams cad na gnas ba'i rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang cig cang 'brel pa de ni thams cad du song ba yin te dper na nam mkha' bzhin /
analyzed: gang yul thams cad na gnas ba'i rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang cig cang 'brel pa de ni thams cad du song ba yin te dper na nam mkha' bzhin /
translated: That which is related to all those that are related to it in all places is all-pervading, like space.

original: spyi yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang cig car 'brel pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: spyi yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang cig car 'brel pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: A universal is related to all those that are related to it in all places.

original: de dang 'brel ba can gyi rang bzhin tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba can gyi rang bzhin tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: That which is related to it is merely a nature that is related to it, and that which is related to it subsequently is a nature that is located in its place.

original: 'di'i gang zhig gang na med pa de ni de'i yul la bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin no zhes pas ni 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gang zhig gang na med pa de ni de'i yul la bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin no zhes pas ni 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is not in this is not pervaded by it in its place. This is the application of a reason of nature.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang /
translated: The second application is:

original: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ni ma dmigs pa de ni de na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ni ma dmigs pa de ni de na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is characterized by non-observation does not exist there,

original: dper na 'ga' zhig na bum pa med pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig na bum pa med pa bzhin /
translated: just as a pot does not exist in some places.

original: spyi yang bsal ba'i bar rnams su dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs so zhes ba'o //
analyzed: spyi yang bsal ba'i bar rnams su dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs so zhes ba'o //
translated: And a universal is not characterized by non-observation in the intervals between the exclusions.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di dang rang bzhin ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gcig la the tshom skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di dang rang bzhin ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gcig la the tshom skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: This non-observation and essence are contradictory in meaning, and therefore they generate doubt in one thing.

original: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthat which is desired to be expressed.‚Äù

original: grangs kyang mtshan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs kyang mtshan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because number is accepted as a characteristic.

original: 'o na tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not to be said, ‚ÄúThe object is seen from the reason having three modes,‚Äù

original: tshul bzhin zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: but rather it is to be said, ‚ÄúThe object is seen from the reason having the mode.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid ni tshul gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gcig nyid ni tshul gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because one is another mode.

original: dngos po'i stobs zhugs kyi rtags kyi dbang du byas nas de skad bshad cing grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid ni lung gi stobs kyis zhugs pa'i dbang du byas nas so zhes pa 'di brjod zin to //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs zhugs kyi rtags kyi dbang du byas nas de skad bshad cing grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid ni lung gi stobs kyis zhugs pa'i dbang du byas nas so zhes pa 'di brjod zin to //
translated: This is explained from the point of view of a reason based on the power of the thing itself, and the desire to state the number one is from the point of view of a reason based on the power of scripture. This has already been explained.

original: des na 'di mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na 'di mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction here.

original: ci ltar da ni lung la brten pa'i rtags las skyes ba de rjes su dpag pa nyid du rtogs par bya /
analyzed: ci ltar da ni lung la brten pa'i rtags las skyes ba de rjes su dpag pa nyid du rtogs par bya /
translated: How is it that what is produced from a reason based on scripture is understood to be inference?

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ji tsam pas de mtshon par byas pa ma yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ji tsam pas de mtshon par byas pa ma yin pas so zhe na /
translated: Because it is not indicated by the definition as it has been explained.

original: gal te @168b yang mtshon par byas pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te @168b yang mtshon par byas pa ma yin mod /
translated: Even if it is not indicated,

original: de lta na yang 'dir yang gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis gsal bar byas so zhes skyon med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir yang gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis gsal bar byas so zhes skyon med do //
translated: still, in this case also, the desire to state the number one for all the definitions of the reason and so on is clearly stated by the text beginning with ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù There is no fault.

original: yang ci'i don du de'i mtshan nyid kyi mdo byas she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i don du de'i mtshan nyid kyi mdo byas she na /
translated: For what purpose is the s≈´tra on its definition composed?

original: gtso bo ma yin pa nyid du shes pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa nyid du shes pa'i don du'o //
translated: and the purpose is to understand that it is not the principal [means of valid cognition].

original: gtso po ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: gtso po ma yin pa ni /
translated: It is not the principal [means of valid cognition]

original: dngos por na de tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos por na de tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because, in reality, it is not a means of valid cognition.

original: lung yang re zhig dngos po'i dbang las tshad ma nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: lung yang re zhig dngos po'i dbang las tshad ma nyid ma yin na /
translated: Even scripture is not a means of valid cognition due to the power of the object.

original: de'i grub pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de'i grub pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much less so is the cognition produced from the reason of its establishment!

original: khas blangs pa'i dbang las ni de tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i dbang las ni de tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
translated: It is established as a means of valid cognition due to the power of acceptance. That is enough of a digression.

original: gnyis ngag las the tshom dang nges pa yang 'thob pa ma yin no zhes khas blangs nyams pa smras so //
analyzed: gnyis ngag las the tshom dang nges pa yang 'thob pa ma yin no zhes khas blangs nyams pa smras so //
translated: [The opponent] says that the claim is undermined, that doubt and certainty are not obtained from the two [means of valid cognition].

original: byas pa nyid dang mnyan par bya ba nyid dag las yang dag pa'i shes pa dang bzlog pa bzhin du the tshom med pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mnyan par bya ba nyid dag las yang dag pa'i shes pa dang bzlog pa bzhin du the tshom med pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as from being produced and being audible, one obtains certainty without doubt,

original: mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum dag las kyang the tshom bzhin du nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum dag las kyang the tshom bzhin du nges pa med pa'o //
translated: and just as from not being perceptible by the eye and being perceptible, there is no certainty like doubt.

original: gnyis dag gis te /üîΩthe tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa las /
analyzed: gnyis dag gis te / the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa las /
translated: Two are causes of doubt and ascertainment.

original: the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu dag the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu dag the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The causes of doubt and ascertainment are called doubt and ascertainment, respectively, by the method of figuratively designating the cause with the name of the result.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /üîΩbyas pa nyid dang mnyan par bya ba nyid 'ba' zhig pa dag la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi / byas pa nyid dang mnyan par bya ba nyid 'ba' zhig pa dag la /
translated: The reason for this is that the author wishes to state that the reason, etc., are one in number, possessing the characteristics of doubt and ascertainment.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But mere production and mere audibility do not have the characteristics of the cause of doubt.

original: mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum pa nyid dag la gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gis gzung bya ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum pa nyid dag la gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: And mere nonapprehensibility by the eye and mere perceptibility do not have the characteristics of the cause of ascertainment.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then do they have?

original: lhan cig pa dag la'o //
analyzed: lhan cig pa dag la'o //
translated: They have the characteristics of the cause of doubt and the cause of ascertainment, respectively, when they are coexistent.

original: 'dir ci zhes pa thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid srid pa'i phyir dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ci zhes pa thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid srid pa'i phyir dri ba'o //
translated: Here, what is asked is whether they are common or uncommon, because it is possible that they are both.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa ni re zhig ces pa la /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa ni re zhig ces pa la /
translated: The non-erroneous contradiction is as follows.

original: re zhig gi sgras thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin ba dag kho na gnon mi za bar the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin zhes ston to //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgras thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin ba dag kho na gnon mi za bar the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin zhes ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in ‚Äúonly for a while‚Äù shows that the common and uncommon are not necessarily causes of doubt.

original: 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang de dag yin la /
translated: They are contradictions because they establish the meaning of contradiction.

original: mi 'khrul ba can dag kyang ngo zhes pa 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba dag go //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba can dag kyang ngo zhes pa 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba dag go //
translated: They are also non-erroneous. Thus they are non-erroneous contradictions.

original: yan lag gi chos kyis tshogs pa la bstan @169a * //
analyzed: yan lag gi chos kyis tshogs pa la bstan @169a * //
translated: Because the property of the part is taught with respect to the whole,

original: pa'i phyir / 'gal pa mi 'khrul ba can zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir / 'gal pa mi 'khrul ba can zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that they are non-erroneous contradictions.

original: yang na 'gal bdag gi mi 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'gal bdag gi mi 'khrul ba ste /
translated: Or, they are non-erroneous contradictions of contradiction.

original: de 'di la yod do zhes pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can te /
analyzed: de 'di la yod do zhes pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can te /
translated: Because they exist here, they are non-erroneous contradictions.

original: de ni 'gal ba don gcig pa mi srid ba'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba don gcig pa mi srid ba'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Because it is impossible for them to have the same meaning, they are causes of doubt.

original: de gcig la med ces pa la sogs pas khas blangs pa nyams pa yongs su spong ste /üîΩgcig kho na la zhes ba /
analyzed: de gcig la med ces pa la sogs pas khas blangs pa nyams pa yongs su spong ste /üîΩgcig kho na la zhes ba /
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not exist in one‚Äù and so on completely abandons the fault of accepting that.üîΩ‚ÄúOnly in one‚Äù and so on completely abandons the fault of accepting that.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid la byas pa nyid dang mnyan bya nyid dag gis tha mi dad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid la byas pa nyid dang mnyan bya nyid dag gis tha mi dad pa gsungs so //
translated: The reason is stated: because of being the cause of doubt.

original: de bzhin du mig gis gzung ba ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum nyid dag nges pa'i rgyu nyid la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis gzung ba ma yin pa nyid dang mngon sum nyid dag nges pa'i rgyu nyid la'o //
translated: Similarly, the reason is stated: because of not being apprehended by the eye and because of being a direct perception.

original: de la du ma las ci ltar nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la du ma las ci ltar nges par 'gyur te /
translated: How can there be ascertainment from many?

original: nges par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na zhe na /
translated: There is no ascertainment at all.

original: gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of the mere desire to express oneness.

original: de yang yod do //
analyzed: de yang yod do //
translated: And that exists.

original: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig nyid rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig nyid rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the mere number one, which is desired to be expressed, is not reasonable.

original: 'o na lung na grub pa dag gi gcig nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin nam 'di dag ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma kho nas grub pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'o na lung na grub pa dag gi gcig nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin nam 'di dag ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma kho nas grub pa dag ste /
translated: But aren't the established [properties] of scripture expressed as one? These are established only by valid cognition that engages through the power of the thing.

original: des na ci'i phyir 'di'i skabs yin zhen /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir 'di'i skabs yin zhen /
translated: So why is this [reasoning] the context?

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: pha rol pos ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i yul mi shes pas /
analyzed: pha rol pos ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i yul mi shes pas /
translated: The opponent, not understanding the object that the master wishes to express as one,

original: yul thams cad la gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'o zhes bsams nas rtsod cing /
analyzed: yul thams cad la gcig nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'o zhes bsams nas rtsod cing /
translated: thinks, ‚ÄúHe wishes to express all objects as one,‚Äù and argues.

original: slob dpon gyis ni re zhig 'di ltar 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni re zhig 'di ltar 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: The master thinks, ‚ÄúLet it be for the time being that this is so.

original: phyis rang gi dgongs pa gsal par bya'o zhes dgongs pas khas blangs nas lan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyis rang gi dgongs pa gsal par bya'o zhes dgongs pas khas blangs nas lan gsungs pa'o //
translated: Later I will clarify my intention,‚Äù and having accepted it, he replies.

original: mi 'gal ba ni zhes pa la sogs ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni zhes pa la sogs ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-contradiction‚Äù and so on.

original: mi 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: Non-contradiction is for the sake of establishing the meaning of non-contradiction.

original: de'i don du ma nyid yod na yang don gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir gcig kho na'o zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i don du ma nyid yod na yang don gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir gcig kho na'o zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: Even though there is multiplicity, because it performs the function of one, it is only one. Thus there is no fault.

original: de lta na gang du zhes pa la sogs pas slar yang don gcig brjod par 'dod pa mi 'thad par gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na gang du zhes pa la sogs pas slar yang don gcig brjod par 'dod pa mi 'thad par gsungs so //
translated: In that case, ‚ÄúWhere‚Äù and so on states that it is not tenable to express the object as one again.

original: re re ni der zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: re re ni der zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: ‚ÄúEach‚Äù and so on.

original: don gcig byed pa nyid ston cing /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa nyid ston cing /
translated: It shows that it performs the function of one.

original: de kho na'i lan gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na'i lan gsungs so //
translated: He replies to that.

original: 'o na gang du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na gang du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhere is there a difference?‚Äù

original: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams la gzhan zhes pa 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa dag ste /üîΩphan tshun gyi mtshams la ltos pas /
analyzed: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams la gzhan zhes pa 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa dag ste / phan tshun gyi mtshams la ltos pas /
translated: The whole is different from the parts. Here, the things to be established are different.üîΩBecause of the mutual dependence on the boundary,

original: gzhan nyid kyi khyad par @169b yan lag dang yan lag can dag bsgrub bya nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi khyad par @169b yan lag dang yan lag can dag bsgrub bya nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the difference is established as the whole and the parts.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs kyang tha dad ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs kyang tha dad ba ste /
translated: Here, the reason is also different.

original: the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i dngos pa'i phyir ro zhes pa the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dag go //
analyzed: the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa'i dngos pa'i phyir ro zhes pa the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dag go //
translated: Because of the thing to be ascertained and the thing to be established, there is doubt and certainty.

original: de ltar ni rkyang ba tsam dmigs pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ni rkyang ba tsam dmigs pa na /
translated: In that case, when only the individual parts are observed,

original: yan lag snal ma rnams la nges pa mthong zhing yan lag can snam bu la sogs la the tshom ste /
analyzed: yan lag snal ma rnams la nges pa mthong zhing yan lag can snam bu la sogs la the tshom ste /
translated: certainty is seen in the parts, such as the threads, and there is doubt about the whole, such as the cloth.

original: ci 'di snam bu'am 'on te yol ba yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'di snam bu'am 'on te yol ba yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is asked, ‚ÄúIs this cloth or is it a curtain?‚Äù

original: gang la the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa yod pa de la gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: gang la the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa yod pa de la gzhan nyid de /
translated: Where there is doubt and certainty, there is difference.

original: dper na dge slong dang ngur smrig dag la bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na dge slong dang ngur smrig dag la bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the case of a monk and the saffron robes.

original: dur smrig tsam mthong pa las ngur smrig la nges pa dang dge slong la the tshom ste /üîΩci 'di sh'a kya'i dge slong ngam /
analyzed: dur smrig tsam mthong pa las ngur smrig la nges pa dang dge slong la the tshom ste / ci 'di sh'a kya'i dge slong ngam /
translated: When one sees just the saffron robes, one is certain about the saffron robes, but one is doubtful about the monk.üîΩOne wonders, ‚ÄúIs this a monk of the ≈öƒÅkya clan or a monk of the Kapila clan?‚Äù

original: 'on te ser skya ba'i dge slong yin zhes ring por gong bu tsam dmigs pa na'o //
analyzed: 'on te ser skya ba'i dge slong yin zhes ring por gong bu tsam dmigs pa na'o //
translated: When one sees just the body, one is doubtful about the person.

original: de la yang gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gzhan nyid ces pa /
analyzed: de la yang gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gzhan nyid ces pa /
translated: In that regard, the phrase ‚Äúthe difference that belongs to both‚Äù means

original: gang yan lag can yan lag las gzhan du gyur ba bde ni srid pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yan lag can yan lag las gzhan du gyur ba bde ni srid pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that it is impossible for the possessor to be different from the possessed parts,

original: yan lag rnams ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: because the parts are not different from it.

original: dper na nag pa bshes gnyen gyi spun ya yin zhes pa la /
analyzed: dper na nag pa bshes gnyen gyi spun ya yin zhes pa la /
translated: For example, it is like the case of saying that Nakula is a brother.

original: de yang de'i spun drang ngo zhes rtogs pa bzhin no //üîΩre re yang gtan tshigs yin zhes pa the tshom ni gtan la phebs pa'i zla bo la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de yang de'i spun drang ngo zhes rtogs pa bzhin no // re re yang gtan tshigs yin zhes pa the tshom ni gtan la phebs pa'i zla bo la ltos pa ste /
translated: One understands that he is a brother of that person.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeach is a reason‚Äù means that doubt depends on the opposite of certainty.

original: gtan la phebs pa yod na the tshom yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
